commit_message:
Microversion 2.40 - Simple tenant usage pagination

Add optional parameters 'limit' and 'marker' to the
os-simple-tenant-usage endpoints for pagaination.

  /os-simple-tenant-usage?limit={limit}&marker={instance_uuid}
  /os-simple-tenant-usage/{tenant}?limit={limit}&marker={instance_uuid}

Implements blueprint paginate-simple-tenant-usage
Depends-on: Ic8e9f869f1b855f968967bedbf77542f287f26c0
Change-Id: If99db6933de012b71cf2c982075f08b3e664361e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/25/407825/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # no time to get instantiated which is OK in this case, so cmd = 'usage-list --start 2000-01-20 --end 2005-02-01' stdout, _ = self.run_command(cmd) # Servers, RAM MB-Hours, CPU Hours, Disk GB-Hours self.assertIn('1 | 25451.76 | 49.71 | 0.00', stdout) def test_usage_list_stitch_together_next_results(self): cmd = 'usage-list --start 2000-01-20 --end 2005-02-01' stdout, _ = self.run_command(cmd, api_version='2.39') self.assert_called('GET', '/os-simple-tenant-usage?' 'start=2000-01-20T00:00:00&' 'end=2005-02-01T00:00:00&' 'detailed=1', pos=0) markers = [ 'f079e394-1111-457b-b350-bb5ecc685cdd', 'f079e394-2222-457b-b350-bb5ecc685cdd', ] for pos, marker in enumerate(markers): self.assert_called('GET', '/os-simple-tenant-usage?' 'start=2000-01-20T00:00:00&' 'end=2005-02-01T00:00:00&' 'marker=%s&detailed=1' % (marker), pos=pos + 1) # Servers, RAM MB-Hours, CPU Hours, Disk GB-Hours self.assertIn('2 | 50903.53 | 99.42 | 0.00', stdout) cmd = 'usage --start 2000-01-20 --end 2005-02-01 --tenant test' stdout, _ = self.run_command(cmd) # Servers, RAM MB-Hours, CPU Hours, Disk GB-Hours self.assertIn('1 | 25451.76 | 49.71 | 0.00', stdout) def test_usage_stitch_together_next_results(self): cmd = 'usage --start 2000-01-20 --end 2005-02-01' stdout, _ = self.run_command(cmd, api_version='2.39') self.assert_called('GET', '/os-simple-tenant-usage/tenant_id?' 'start=2000-01-20T00:00:00&' 'end=2005-02-01T00:00:00', pos=0) markers = [ 'f079e394-1111-457b-b350-bb5ecc685cdd', 'f079e394-2222-457b-b350-bb5ecc685cdd', ] for pos, marker in enumerate(markers): self.assert_called('GET', '/os-simple-tenant-usage/tenant_id?' 'start=2000-01-20T00:00:00&' 'end=2005-02-01T00:00:00&' 'marker=%s' % (marker), pos=pos + 1) # Servers, RAM MB-Hours, CPU Hours, Disk GB-Hours self.assertIn('2 | 50903.53 | 99.42 | 0.00', stdout)
deleted_lines: # no time to get instantatiated which is OK in this case, so self.run_command('usage-list --start 2000-01-20 --end 2005-02-01') self.run_command('usage --start 2000-01-20 --end 2005-02-01 ' '--tenant test')

subject: Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 14:40:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/26684158fd1be29a4cebc9698ee60051334e8b73', 'message': 'Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute

Revert I3aaf8ced1ac406069f2d6e3b52b8d59eddda7eac to fix a bug where
deployments not using OVS+DVR contain unnecessary group mappings
that are filtered out within the Neutron role. Instead, we stop
adding these services to the compute host groups by default, and
conditionally add them when DVR is selected as the Neutron plugin.

Change-Id: I543d1b5d3d50b6e7936605f436805d2f0ad9b3e9
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-15 14:40:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/d1397756dfcc110a6d9064ba573a18635aaa100c', 'message': 'Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute

Revert I3aaf8ced1ac406069f2d6e3b52b8d59eddda7eac to fix a bug where
deployments not using OVS+DVR contain unnecessary group mappings
that are filtered out within the Neutron role. Instead, we stop
adding these services to the compute host groups by default, and
conditionally add them when DVR is selected as the Neutron plugin.

commit_message:
Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute

Revert I3aaf8ced1ac406069f2d6e3b52b8d59eddda7eac to fix a bug where
deployments not using OVS+DVR contain unnecessary group mappings
that are filtered out within the Neutron role. Instead, we stop
adding these services to the compute host groups by default, and
conditionally add them when DVR is selected as the Neutron plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1645979
Change-Id: I543d1b5d3d50b6e7936605f436805d2f0ad9b3e9

commit_message:
Don't pin Tempest if jobs are run in Tempest gate

Do not pin Tempest if the jobs are run in Tempest gate, so they can
actually see the errors we have without the pin.

Change-Id: I439dc6b8200a59f31c0227a124b4a2a6e8d443ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/05/412605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we don't pin Tempest in Tempest gate, so we can actually run # real tests in order to fix Tempest. if [[ "$ZUUL_PROJECT" != "openstack/tempest" ]]; then # openstack/tempest/master interface breaks Trove and more services. # There is an attempt to fix it here: # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412511/ # Let's pin Tempest until the fix works and is merged. git checkout 382a2065f3364a36c110bfcc6275a0f8f6894773 fi

commit_message:
Make Bandit's HTML report pass markup validation Bandit's HTML report previously generated invalid markup, according to https://validator.w3.org/. Changes: - Add a character set - Fix duplicate IDs - Avoid
s inside of s - Remove excess slashes from
tags - Use double quotes for attributes (stylistic) Change-Id: Ie811299b05bc5229d4e76511e06db6d8c89110d6 Closes-Bug: #1650391

commit_message:
Make sure gnocchi is enabled before ceilometer

Ceilometer upgrade will contact gnocchi so we must make sure gnocchi is
enabled before ceilometer in devstack.

Change-Id: I876b6b7551b00991685c3f9dee7610668b8a8864
Closes-Bug: #1649259
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/05/410505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure gnocchi is enabled before ceilometer function _ceilometer_check_for_gnocchi { if [ "$CEILOMETER_BACKEND" == 'gnocchi' ]; then local plugins="${DEVSTACK_PLUGINS}" local plugin local seen_gnocchi=False for plugin in ${plugins//,/ }; do if [ "$plugin" == 'gnocchi' ]; then seen_gnocchi=True elif [ "$plugin" == 'ceilometer' ]; then [[ "$seen_gnocchi" == 'False' ]] && die $LINENO "gnocchi must be enabled before ceilometer!" fi done fi } _ceilometer_check_for_gnocchi

tempest: support keystone v3 for autoscaling

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/93/411393/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_keystone_v3 = 'catalog' in auth[1] if is_keystone_v3: if endpoint_type.endswith("URL"): endpoint_type = endpoint_type[:-3] catalog = auth[1]['catalog'] endpoints = [e['endpoints'] for e in catalog if e['type'] == opt_section.catalog_type] if not endpoints: raise Exception("%s endpoint not found" % config.CONF.metric.catalog_type) endpoints = [e['url'] for e in endpoints[0] if e['interface'] == endpoint_type] if not endpoints: raise Exception("%s interface not found for endpoint %s" % (endpoint_type, config.CONF.metric.catalog_type)) return endpoints[0] else: if not endpoint_type.endswith("URL"): endpoint_type += "URL" catalog = auth[1]['serviceCatalog'] endpoints = [e for e in catalog if e['type'] == opt_section.catalog_type] if not endpoints: raise Exception("%s endpoint not found" % config.CONF.metric.catalog_type) return endpoints[0]['endpoints'][0][endpoint_type]
deleted_lines: if not endpoint_type.endswith("URL"): endpoint_type += "URL" endpoints = [e for e in auth[1]['serviceCatalog'] if e['type'] == opt_section.catalog_type] if not endpoints: raise Exception("%s endpoint not found" % config.CONF.metric.catalog_type) return endpoints[0]['endpoints'][0][endpoint_type]

commit_message:
Update os_workers to have other options

Adding additional options for os_workers.rb:

        os_workers_small
        os_workers_large

os_workers will provide response times close to what
$::processorcount had (with two sockets machines).

os_workers_small will be the existing calculation.

os_workers_large can be used where services are distributed across
multiple machines and high worker count is not a concern.

Closes-bug: #1650424

Change-Id: I5dce760044d49ef9e3c88736c73cc267fd039ae7

added_lines: # # The value above for os_workers performs 3x worse in many cases compared to # the prevuous default of $::processorcount. # # Based on performance data [1], the following calculation is within 1-2%. # # The value for os_workers is max between '(<# processors> / 2)' and '2' with # a cap of 12. # # [1] http://elk.browbeatproject.org:80/goto/a23307fd511e314b975dedca6f65425d # Facter.add(:os_workers_medium) do has_weight 100 setcode do processors = Facter.value('processorcount') [ [ (processors.to_i / 2), 2 ].max, 12 ].min end end # # For cases where services are not co-located together (ie monolithic). # Facter.add(:os_workers_high) do has_weight 100 setcode do processors = Facter.value('processorcount') [ (processors.to_i / 2) ] end end

subject: Fix crash-loop in thresholder caused by floating point numbers used as dimension filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 12:36:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common/commit/fdaccaa9920554c76b0298bb68d4b2a0b1085848', 'message': 'Fix crash-loop in thresholder caused by floating point numbers used as dimension filter (e.g. avg(some_timer{quantile=0.99}) > 0.1)

* add DECIMAL (floating point value) to allowed tokens for dimensions
* use antlr 4.2.2 instead of 4.2.0

Without this fix, an alarm-definition like the above one will break the Java-ORM layer because the alarm-definition (submitted using the Python API) cannot be parsed by the generated ANTLR parser. As a consequence the thresholder worker will terminate, leading to a crash-cycle. I could not find a way to make the ORM-layer ignore non-parseable alarm-definitions. So maybe this fix should be complemented by an extension of the Python API that uses exactly the same ANTLR grammar to validate incoming alarm-definitions.

Change-Id: Ibbd41e1b817ebadc74b1b4a677db898cfa173ccb

commit_message:
Fix crash-loop in thresholder caused by floating point numbers used as dimension filter

Example: avg(some_timer{quantile=0.99}) > 0.1)

Changes:
* add DECIMAL (floating point value) to allowed tokens for dimensions

Without this fix, an alarm-definition like the above one once injected
through the Python API will break the Java-ORM layer because the
alarm-definition cannot be parsed by the generated ANTLR parser.
As a consequence the thresholder worker will terminate, leading to a
crash-cycle. I could not find a way to make the ORM-layer ignore
non-parseable alarm-definitions. So maybe this fix should be
complemented by an extension of the Python API that uses exactly the
same ANTLR grammar to validate incoming alarm-definitions.

Change-Id: Ibbd41e1b817ebadc74b1b4a677db898cfa173ccb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common refs/changes/93/404193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Python 3: fix glance.tests.functional.db.test_sqlalchemy

This patch fixes 3 issues:
- "RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration"
- "TypeError: 'map' object is not subscriptable"
- "TypeError: object of type 'map' has no len()"

Change-Id: If52ab336512f37b6e5ad6c748bef7996c67cb71a

commit_message:
Revert "Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration"

It turns out the puppet-mistral change this depends on broke
introspection, so we need to back it out for now.

This reverts commit ed029e5bf279945e82bff8766af4093856a7ac6a.

Change-Id: I828478267935cdc68aa24de8c9dc2d12fcadb631

commit_message:
Use correct section for host and port settings

The module configured the bind_host and bind_port as
part of the api section, which does not exist in config
reference. The correct section should be DEFAULT. With
the setting being in api, the api service starts up with
binding to host 127.0.0.1 instead of 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I90218f65cc60c546c7ef43d9f5a464d9e7031431
Closes-Bug: 1650837
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-octavia refs/changes/64/412164/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'configures bind_host and bind_port' do is_expected.to contain_octavia_config('DEFAULT/host').with_value( params[:host] ) is_expected.to contain_octavia_config('DEFAULT/port').with_value( params[:port] )
deleted_lines: it 'configures api' do is_expected.to contain_octavia_config('api/host').with_value( params[:host] ) is_expected.to contain_octavia_config('api/port').with_value( params[:port] )

commit_message:
Add missing tests for the image v2 API

This commit adds missing test cases for the image v2 API, the missing
test cases are for listing images using different parameters for
filtering the lists.

This commit also fixes one test which was attempting to validate the
use of the container_format filter using a value that was not found
in the test environment.

Change-Id: Ia1369fa73f56ec290e868d3f2f2873785a70951d
Closes-Bug: 1086590

commit_message:
Disable legacy ceilometer api by default

Ceilometer api is deprectaed in Ocata. Lets disable by default.
This can still be enabled by setting enable_legacy_ceilometer_api
param.

Change-Id: Iffb8c2cfed53d8b29e777c35cee44921194239e9

commit_message:
DNS fix

The gate switched to unbind on centos too. This PS changes
the checks to apply the ubuntu workaround to centos as well.

Change-Id: I64e4e5ba09403d7fe6c6652ca9da63bc20fbfe0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/69/412569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else sudo yum clean all sudo yum install -y bridge-utilssudo brctl addbr dns0 sudo ifconfig dns0 172.19.0.1 netmask 255.255.255.0 (echo server:; echo " interface: 172.19.0.1"; echo " access-control: 0.0.0.0/0 allow") | \ sudo /bin/bash -c "cat > /etc/unbound/unbound.conf.d/kubernetes.conf" sudo dpkg -l | grep -i resolv sudo systemctl restart unbound sudo systemctl status unbound sudo netstat -pnl sudo sed -i "s/127\.0\.0\.1/172.19.0.1/" /etc/resolv.conf sudo cat /etc/resolv.conf
deleted_lines: sudo brctl addbr dns0 sudo ifconfig dns0 172.19.0.1 netmask 255.255.255.0 (echo server:; echo " interface: 172.19.0.1"; echo " access-control: 0.0.0.0/0 allow") | \ sudo /bin/bash -c "cat > /etc/unbound/unbound.conf.d/kubernetes.conf" sudo dpkg -l | grep -i resolv sudo systemctl restart unbound sudo systemctl status unbound sudo netstat -pnl sudo sed -i "s/127\.0\.0\.1/172.19.0.1/" /etc/resolv.conf sudo cat /etc/resolv.conf

subject: Avoid double-check when waiting for test states
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-18 18:11:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/08474bdf3d8dc0a1e9c2633e38f0d6efe0f07bd3', 'message': "Avoid double-check when waiting for test states

Sometimes tests fail becaused there's a double check for
the instance state.  If the state changes in between the
two checks, the test will fail to acknowledge the first
'correct' response and timeout while waiting for the state
to re-occur (which doesn't happen).

Sample output would look like:
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'REBOOT'.
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Status of instance '<id>' did not change to 'REBOOT' after 1201.3s.

Change-Id: I9731bf7a93e7b8b3398cf73d1bc15d70f5bfa96a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-18 19:38:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/4d473ffb0ce30b78b4b8fe912e9d759d8cef8917', 'message': "Avoid double-check when waiting for test states

...

...
[REPORT] Status of instance '<id>' did not change to 'REBOOT' after 1201.3s.

Also broke down the instance-create tests into instance-create and
instance-init-create so that the initialzed instance won't
need to be created for manual runs or multi runs in the gate.

commit_message:
Avoid double-check when waiting for test states

Sometimes tests fail becaused there's a double check for
the instance state.  If the state changes in between the
two checks, the test will fail to acknowledge the first
'correct' response and timeout while waiting for the state
to re-occur (which doesn't happen).

Sample output would look like:
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'REBOOT'.
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Status of instance '<id>' did not change to 'REBOOT' after 1201.3s.

Also broke down the instance-create tests into instance-create and
instance-init-create so that the initialzed instance won't
need to be created for manual runs or multi runs in the gate.

Reorganized the backup create so that on fast nodes there's
more chance that the backup is still around while the
negative tests run.

Change-Id: I9731bf7a93e7b8b3398cf73d1bc15d70f5bfa96a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/29/412229/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: found_current = self._has_status( instance_id, status, fast_fail_status=fast_fail_status) if require_all_states or found or found_current: if not found_current: poll_until(lambda: self._has_status( instance_id, status, fast_fail_status=fast_fail_status), sleep_time=self.def_sleep_time, time_out=self.def_timeout)
deleted_lines: if require_all_states or found or self._has_status( instance_id, status, fast_fail_status=fast_fail_status): poll_until(lambda: self._has_status( instance_id, status, fast_fail_status=fast_fail_status), sleep_time=self.def_sleep_time, time_out=self.def_timeout)

subject: Separate hacking check factories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 18:22:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/74f162cb43c3af34379fdcf13ee7958209f4a722', 'message': "No hacking checks via entry points

With the introduction of [1], we started registering neutron-lib
hacking checks via entry points so that they were available via
the flake8 CLI by default (when neutron-lib is installed). While
this is great, neutron registers its own hacking checks [2], some
of which are the same (function name) as those we setup via
entry points in neutron-lib. This naming conflict causes issues
with pep8's registration logic (see error from bug).

While ideally we'd just use neutron-lib's checks from neutron's
check factory, neutron's version of these checks uses a different
hacking code for the checks and a number of consumer's of neutron
run and ignore/select based on neutron's code. So we cannot just
up and change them in neutron.

A subsequent set of patches will deprecate these duplicated checks
in neutron that can later be replaced by their counterpart in neutron-lib.

Note: This patch leaves the hacking proxy class and entry point as a
subsequent patch will make _register_and_enable_checks() public
and doc it as the recommended way to register checks.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333500/
[2] https://goo.gl/dgYqX8

Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d
Closes-Bug: #bug/1609478
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-04 15:17:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/6d4be59b99b894ac6cf72761917d714a73c41d00', 'message': 'No hacking checks via entry points

With the introduction of [1], we started registering neutron-lib
hacking checks via entry points so that they were available via
the flake8 CLI by default (when neutron-lib is installed). While
this is great, neutron registers its own hacking checks [2], some
of which are the same (function name) as those we setup via
entry points in neutron-lib. This naming conflict causes issues
with pep8's registration logic (see error from bug).

While ideally we'd just use neutron-lib's checks in neutron's
check factory, neutron's version of these checks uses a different
hacking code for the checks and a number of consumer's of neutron
run and ignore/select based on neutron's code. So we cannot just
up and change them in neutron as consumers will be impacted without
proper deprecation notice.

This exercise also exemplifies that neutron-lib hacking checks can
become obtrusive given pep8's (as well as hacking and flake8) limited
API for managing checks and registration behavior. For example, checks
can be "auto" registered via not only entry points, but also via hacking
local checks if a tox.ini is present and without an API to cleanly
manipulate these checks, we are at the mercy of pep8s current behavior.

Therefore this patch:
- Undoes the entry point registration of lib's checks from [1].
- Sets the checks back to "on" by default from [1].
- Makes _register_and_enable_checks public and updates its behavior
to conveniently register checks in batch and guard against the ill effects
of re-registering a duplicate check.
- Undoes the hacking check proxy from [1]; no need for it as it's purpose
was to support changing off_by_default for entry point registered checks.
- Updates the UTs based on the above.
- Updates the usage dev-ref based on the above.

Once we get neutron using lib's hacking checks, we are revisit the need
auto-register neutron-lib checks via entry points.

A subsequent set of patches will deprecate these duplicated checks
in neutron that can later be replaced by their counterpart in neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333500/
[2] https://goo.gl/dgYqX8

Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d
Closes-Bug: #bug/1609478
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-08 14:53:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/467ad1de6e0956907da8bee89c764f4d4435c64d', 'message': 'No hacking checks via entry points

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-15 16:39:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/7c2b40e7819d1f675615b4b679ba0292294da6c0', 'message': 'Separate lib and adoptor check factories

With the introduction of [1], we started registering neutron-lib
hacking checks via entry points so that they were available via
the flake8 CLI by default (when neutron-lib is installed). While
this is great, neutron registers its own hacking checks [2], some
of which are the same (function name) as those we setup via
entry points in neutron-lib. This naming conflict causes issues
with pep8's registration logic (see error from bug). Note that
[1] has been reverted.

While ideally we'd just use neutron-lib's checks in neutron's
check factory, neutron's version of these checks uses a different
hacking code for the checks and a number of consumer's of neutron
run and ignore/select based on neutron's code. So we cannot just
up and change them in neutron as consumers will be impacted without
proper deprecation notice.

This exercise also exemplifies that neutron-lib hacking checks can
become obtrusive given pep8's (as well as hacking and flake8) limited
API for managing checks and registration behavior. For example, checks
can be "auto" registered via not only entry points, but also via hacking
local checks if a tox.ini is present and without an API to cleanly
manipulate these checks, we are at the mercy of pep8s current behavior.

Therefore this patch:
- Clearly separates neutron-lib internal checks from adoptor checks by
using explicit factory function names; deprecating factory().
- Decorates our checks as flake8exts.
- Makes _register_and_enable_checks public and updates its behavior
to conveniently register checks in batch and guard against the ill effects
of re-registering a duplicate check.
- Updates the UTs based on the above.
- Updates the usage dev-ref based on the above.

Once we get neutron using lib's hacking checks, we are revisit the need
auto-register neutron-lib checks via entry points.

A subsequent set of patches will deprecate these duplicated checks
in neutron that can later be replaced by their counterpart in neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333500/
[2] https://goo.gl/dgYqX8

Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d
Closes-Bug: #1609478
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-29 20:20:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/00791be8bfd35b27b2f38adde9e91ec572417089', 'message': "Roll-out hacking checks using incubation

As we've learned already:
- New hacking checks can easily break our consumers pep8 gates [1] if
the consumer uses neutron-lib hacking check factory.
- pep8/flake8 have somewhat limited support for manipulating registered
checks and are susceptible to unexpected failures [2].

This patch introduces an easy way to roll-out  checks using an incubation
process for new adopter hacking checks in lib including an easy way consumers
can add 1 LOC to their tox.ini to run incubating checks in warn-only mode in
their pep8 jobs.

This patch contains:
- flake8ext compliant decorators are provided that allow neutron-lib's
hacking check functions to be tagged (lib, incubating, adopter).
- Incubating check functions are wrapped with moved_function to indicate
the incubating status.
- Separate hacking check factories are provided for adopter and incubating
checks for use with tox.ini.
- A simple flake8 extension is provided at adds a '--neutron_lib_incubating'
CLI option to flake8 to run incubating checks. This is intended to be used
with flake8 for a warn-only option of adopter checks.
- Usage docs are updated; reflecting this process.
- UTs.

When/if this patch lands, I'll go around and update all the stadium projects that
use neutron-lib's hacking check factory to also run the incubating checks
in their gate in warn-only mode.  e.g. update their tox.ini with:

[testenv:pep8]
commands =
     # run adopter_hacking_check_factory checks in fail mode
      flake8
      # run adopter checks in warn-only mode
      flake8 --neutron_lib_incubating --exit-zero

[hacking]
local-check-factory = neutron_lib.hacking.checks.adopter_hacking_check_factory

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360590/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1609478

Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d
Closes-Bug: #1609478

"}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2016-12-07 21:11:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/9efdf3af7cca116d125c5777a2000d3c477e1a83', 'message': "Separate hacking check factories

Neutron-lib adopters should be using neutron-lib's hacking
checks (factory) to validate compliance, but are susceptible
to breakage when new checks are released in neutron-lib (see
partial bug). What we need is a way to roll-out adopter hacking
checks in a controlled manner, giving consumers the opportunity
and tools to comply with new checks.

This patch begins to address this need by:
- Separating neutron-lib hacking checks into 3 separate factories;
adopter, incubating and neutron-lib internal (private).
- Moving any existing checks into their respective factory.
- Updating the usage docs on how to adopt our hacking checks.
- Trusty ole unit test; for obvious reasons.

This patch plays a part in a longer term hacking check strategy:
- Adopters must run neutron-lib's hacking check factory() or its
equivalent via their pep8 checks. This is part of their pep8 gate job
once they update their tox.ini to use neutron's factory().
- Adopters must run a non-voting neutron-lib-pep8-incubating gate job
that runs pep8 with neutron-lib's incubating_factory(). This is means
to warn adopters of upcoming checks without failing their gates.
This job will be created (by me) assuming reviewers agree to this approach.
- We'll communicate hacking checks via the standard means (see usage
docs herein).

Closure of Bug #1609478 will follow completion of the strategy above.

Partial-Bug: #1609478
Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d

commit_message:
Separate hacking check factories

Neutron-lib adopters should be using neutron-lib's hacking
checks (factory) to validate compliance, but are susceptible
to breakage when new checks are released in neutron-lib (see
partial bug). What we need is a way to roll-out adopter hacking
checks in a controlled manner, giving consumers the opportunity
and tools to comply with new checks.

This patch begins to address this need by:
- Separating neutron-lib hacking checks into 3 separate factories;
adopter, incubating and neutron-lib internal (private).
- Moving any existing checks into their respective factory.
- Updating the usage docs on how to adopt our hacking checks.
- Trusty ole unit test; for obvious reasons.

This patch plays a part in a longer term hacking check strategy:
- Adopters must run neutron-lib's hacking check factory() or its
equivalent via their pep8 checks. This is part of their pep8 gate job
once they update their tox.ini to use neutron's factory().
- Adopters must run a non-voting neutron-lib-pep8-incubating gate job
that runs pep8 with neutron-lib's incubating_factory(). This is means
to warn adopters of upcoming checks without failing their gates.
This job will be created (by me) assuming reviewers agree to this approach.
- We'll communicate hacking checks via the standard means (see usage
docs herein).

Closure of Bug #1609478 will follow completion of the strategy above.

Partial-Bug: #1609478
Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/23/350723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration"

To test whether the puppet-mistral change is actually what
broke us, we need to go back to the old config method.

This reverts commit 0cb4fbdad7949b73b692589438d7171dbcdc7aea.

Change-Id: Ia27a06abdb51e2dde91f298ff5e979aec4b5c8f9

commit_message:
Revert "Fix the flicker of the log on button name"

This change has caused my "Sign In" button to be hidden on the login page.

This reverts commit ce3a0fbdd94ffb954ca390c5e93fb1140af984e4.

Closes-Bug: #1651234

Change-Id: I3c0ef6a20ac79c2c3e498a3b692a3165deed81b3

commit_message:
Gate fix for helm sometimes failing

Helm is currently being deployed before canal. This may sometimes
take too long to recover from this situation failing the gate.
This ps moves it till after canal has successfully launched.

Change-Id: I12ac6547756fef437c5c1f5b39c57940cf370bef

commit_message:
Refactor batch encrypt/decrpyts of params, props

A little more DRY.

Change-Id: I062987faa19db493f15ed71c207b7f81ef86cfd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/02/361902/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _db_encrypt_or_decrypt_template_params( ctxt, encryption_key, encrypt=False, batch_size=50, verbose=False): from heat.engine import template session = ctxt.session excs = [] if encrypt: crypt_action = _('encrypt') else: crypt_action = _('decrypt') query = session.query(models.RawTemplate) for raw_template in _get_batch( session=session, ctxt=ctxt, query=query, model=models.RawTemplate, batch_size=batch_size): try: if verbose: LOG.info(_LI("Processing raw_template %(id)d..."), {'id': raw_template.id}) env = raw_template.environment needs_update = False # using "i env.keys()" so an exception is raised # if env is something werid like a string. if env is None or 'parameters' not in env.keys(): continue if 'encrypted_param_names' in env: encrypted_params = env['encrypted_param_names'] else: encrypted_params = [] if encrypt: tmpl = template.Template.load( ctxt, raw_template.id, raw_template) param_schemata = tmpl.param_schemata() if not param_schemata: continue for param_name, param_val in env['parameters'].items(): if (param_name in encrypted_params or param_name not in param_schemata or not param_schemata[param_name].hidden): continue encrypted_val = crypt.encrypt(six.text_type(param_val), encryption_key) env['parameters'][param_name] = encrypted_val encrypted_params.append(param_name) needs_update = True if needs_update: environment = env.copy() environment['encrypted_param_names'] = encrypted_params else: # decrypt for param_name in encrypted_params: method, value = env['parameters'][param_name] decrypted_val = crypt.decrypt(method, value, encryption_key) env['parameters'][param_name] = decrypted_val needs_update = True if needs_update: environment = env.copy() environment['encrypted_param_names'] = [] if needs_update: raw_template_update(ctxt, raw_template.id, {'environment': environment}) except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to %(crypt_action)s parameters of raw ' 'template %(id)d'), {'id': raw_template.id, 'crypt_action': crypt_action}) excs.append(exc) continue finally: if verbose: LOG.info(_LI("Finished %(crypt_action)s processing of " "raw_template %(id)d."), {'id': raw_template.id, 'crypt_action': crypt_action}) return excs def _db_encrypt_or_decrypt_resource_prop_data( ctxt, encryption_key, encrypt=False, batch_size=50, verbose=False): session = ctxt.session excs = [] if encrypt: crypt_action = _('encrypt') else: crypt_action = _('decrypt') # Older resources may have properties_data in the legacy column, # so update those as needed query = session.query(models.Resource).filter( models.Resource.properties_data_encrypted.isnot(encrypt)) for resource in _get_batch( session=session, ctxt=ctxt, query=query, model=models.Resource, batch_size=batch_size): if not resource.properties_data: continue try: if verbose: LOG.info(_LI("Processing resource %(id)d..."), {'id': resource.id}) if encrypt: result = crypt.encrypted_dict(resource.properties_data, encryption_key) else: result = crypt.decrypted_dict(resource.properties_data, encryption_key) resource_update(ctxt, resource.id, {'properties_data': result, 'properties_data_encrypted': encrypt}, resource.atomic_key) except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to %(crypt_action)s properties_data of ' 'resource %(id)d') % {'id': resource.id, 'crypt_action': crypt_action}) excs.append(exc) continue finally: if verbose: LOG.info(_LI("Finished processing resource " "%(id)d."), {'id': resource.id}) return excs excs = [] with ctxt.session.begin(subtransactions=True): excs.extend(_db_encrypt_or_decrypt_template_params( ctxt, encryption_key, True, batch_size, verbose)) excs.extend(_db_encrypt_or_decrypt_resource_prop_data( ctxt, encryption_key, True, batch_size, verbose)) return excs with ctxt.session.begin(subtransactions=True): excs.extend(_db_encrypt_or_decrypt_template_params( ctxt, encryption_key, False, batch_size, verbose)) excs.extend(_db_encrypt_or_decrypt_resource_prop_data( ctxt, encryption_key, False, batch_size, verbose)) return excs

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 15:35:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/f6d21c41f413e2f8f83a2a4e06a432a200bf0a84', 'message': 'Add portgroup configuration fields

and adds a new API microversion to work with them.

Change-Id: Id8c62fa56908040b0df16cc54c122ce2473a4587
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-29 18:46:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/f9ed92badf8cab7fc0983a7e41653b8cf666ee34', 'message': "Add portgroup configuration fields

This change adds mode and properties fields into portgroup object
and adds a new API microversion to work with them.

microversions.

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-29 18:58:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/4a5361afed2d6f3c144f1f912f07486f1da115a0', 'message': "Add portgroup configuration fields

commit_message:
Add portgroup configuration fields

This change adds mode and properties fields into portgroup object
and adds a new API microversion to work with them.

It also makes portgroups' address field optional for all API
microversions.

Partial-Bug: #1618754
Change-Id: Id8c62fa56908040b0df16cc54c122ce2473a4587

commit_message:
Fix policy dict checkers

After the ironic context refactor, the default policy values were
changed to use project_domain_id and project_name, while not
changing the checker methods in API to fetch the correct values
from the context. This change fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1650203
Change-Id: If9bf67b9d7d6f66b12a99d1ee7826af9634415b5

commit_message:
Add "update_access" interface support for VNX.

The VNX manila driver doesn't support the "update_access" API.
Add support for this API which implements following functions:
* Add a list of access rules.
* Remove a list of access rules.
* Recover access rules.

Change-Id: I49de0864e2f2c74d1b4d0f57fa0939a6d8c7c5df
Implements: blueprint vnx-manila-update-access

commit_message:
Fixing vswitchd crash

Entrypoint does not have exit binary as a result it was failing. Removing
COMMAND argument from entrypoint variables.

Change-Id: I437c7b6269837bd642345d6ac9a0037a59658ad8

commit_message:
Test plan delete with stack delete

We recently broke the plan delete but it is not checked anywhere in CI.
This change adds a plan delete to the overcloud delete which is tested
perodically.

Change-Id: I91cb266eb74981b8e2757f0dc431566d41cb7155
Depends-On: I33032c9e6f4a8cf002e65ebab60752c44fb5fdb2
Related-Bug: #1647747

commit_message:
Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration

The upstream puppet module is adding the proper keystone authtoken
middleware support. This change updates THT to use the keystone
authtoken class rather than the deprecated settings. This also allows
for proper keystone v3 integration.

Change-Id: Iaf82716122a25e3e0785de1250d24edaaa5e4d04
Depends-On: I71969ef09018f9daa5f81c4f3bcbdb0b0974446c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/77/409477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove notes about MongoDB

There's no MongoDB anymore anywhere.

Change-Id: Id6f912b48d6c36478ef8db9a08bd3502ed94eb2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/33/411333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. note:: The *not* operator has different meaning in Mongo DB and in SQL DB engine. If the *not* operator is applied on a non existent metadata field then the result depends on the DB engine. For example, if {"not": {"metadata.nonexistent_field" : "some value"}} filter is used in a query the Mongo DB will return every Sample object as *not* operator evaluated true for every Sample where the given field does not exists. See more in the Mongod DB doc. On the other hand, SQL based DB engine will return empty result as the join operation on the metadata table will return zero rows as the on clause of the join which tries to match on the metadata field name is never fulfilled.

commit_message:
Fixing minor capitalizing and other changes

Fixing some capitalizing and also updated quotes/ticks to be
uniform. Also, minor edits to messages, so that they are bit
more clear.

Change-Id: I3c78e4a4500592e28381b17c6e714ef2822eefdc

added_lines: 'msg': 'Trailing whitespace', It is conventional to have a single newline at the end of the file. syntax mode or determine MIME-type, such as the `file` command, gerrit and code editors. to overly complex functions; in which case these functions should be refactored into smaller chunks. Ensure consistency of `do` directive being on the same line as its command. For example: 'msg': 'The `then` keyword not on same line as `if` or `elif` keyword', Similar to E010, this ensures consistency of `if`/`elif` statements This check ensures the closure of heredocs (`<<EOF` directives). 'msg': 'Arithmetic expansion using `$[` is deprecated for `$((`', `$[` is deprecated and not explained in the Bash manual. `$((` The return value of `local` is always 0; errors in subshells used for declaration are thus hidden and will not trigger `set -e`. The return value of ((expr)) is 1 if `expr` evalues to zero, otherwise 0. Combined with `set -e`, this can be quite the `$((` operator.
deleted_lines: 'msg': 'Trailing Whitespace', It is conventional to have a single newline ending files. syntax mode or determine MIME-type, such as file, gerrit and editors. to overly complex functions which require refactoring into smaller chunks. Ensure consistency of "do" directive being on the same line as it's command. For example: 'msg': 'Then keyword is not on same line as if or elif keyword', Similar to E010, this ensures consistency of if/elif statements This check ensures the closure of heredocs (<<EOF directives). 'msg': 'Arithmetic expansion using $[ is deprecated for $((', $[ is deprecated and not explained in the Bash manual. $(( The return value of "local" is always 0; errors in subshells used for declaration are thus hidden and will not trigger "set -e". The return value of ((expr)) is 1 if "expr" evalues to zero, otherwise 0. Combined with "set -e", this can be quite the $(( operator.

commit_message:
Few updates for baremtal dependent tests

Patch - Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85
remove the baremetal tests from tempest and so config
options.
New config options 'shared_physical_network' is being
added to check whether env support shared network or
network isolation.

But few tests are being skipped wrongly seems.

This patch fix those.

Change-Id: I59c757c3c32b961cdf92e393e01612115de5bdce

commit_message:
Pin tempest to unblock CI scenarios

openstack/tempest/master interface breaks Trove and more services.
There is an attempt to fix it here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412511/
Let's pin Tempest until the fix works and is merged.

Change-Id: Iadf7c3164d2f16c5caa1b5d53089f35b22b7b289
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/55/412555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add gnocchi support on undercloud

with ceilometer api being deprecated, we need gnocchi to process
metrics. This patch adds gnocchi on undercloud when telemetry
is enabled.

Implements: blueprint gnocchi-undercloud

Change-Id: I8cca1bee47fae8adf715e70e4ccb61db47c16d98

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/faaad3def44c7a78e0eee86753134cd6\n'

Change-Id: I24b3a6d43dc5fb6ed404a1a8506b4bddc2ba9bb6

ironic.yaml: Remove stable/liberty specific checks

The stable/liberty branch is gone. Remove the stable/liberty specific
checks for the ironic.yaml jobs.

Change-Id: Iaea8d2bbf27c07c9eb1adc145da654ac9a80b83a

added_lines:
case "{ramdisk-type}" in 'tinyipa') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=384" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'tinyipa256') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=256" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'coreos') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=coreos" ;; # if using a ramdisk without a known good value, use the devstack # default by not exporting any value for IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM esac # Enable devstack plugin, unless explicitly disabled if [[ -z "$IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX='ironic' export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic"

if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ] ; then # Standardize VM size for each supported ramdisk case "{ramdisk-type}" in 'tinyipa') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=384" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'tinyipa256') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=256" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=tinyipa" ;; 'coreos') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE=coreos" ;; # if using a ramdisk without a known good value, use the devstack # default by not exporting any value for IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM esac else # For kilo and liberty, we still need 1280mb of ram as # we only have the CoreOS ramdisk. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280" fi # devstack plugin didn't exist until mitaka if [[ -z "$IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN" && "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then # tempest-lib support was added in Mitaka. Fall back to tempest for other stable branches. if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "stable/liberty" ] ; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX='baremetal' else export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX='ironic' fi # devstack plugin didn't exist until mitaka if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" else export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="" fi # devstack plugin didn't exist until mitaka if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" else export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="" fi

commit_message:
Initial implementation of jsonschema validator

This is the initial implementation of a jsonschema type
validator for the Zun API. By using jsonschema to validate API requests,
we can make parameters that are passed in fit the criteria we allow and
what is specified in the Zun API spec. This will also allow us to
validate parameters by wrapping the method that needs validation.

Partially-Implements: blueprint api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: Ia663e35d9744f19b4daff3f370a5831ac9205369
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/25/411125/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from zun.common import exception from zun.common.validation import parameter_types from zun.common.validation import validators from zun.tests import base CONTAINER_CREATE = { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'name': parameter_types.container_name, 'image': parameter_types.image_name, 'command': parameter_types.command, 'cpu': parameter_types.cpu, 'memory': parameter_types.memory, 'workdir': parameter_types.workdir, 'hostname': parameter_types.hostname, 'image_pull_policy': parameter_types.image_pull_policy }, 'required': ['image'], 'additionalProperties': False, } class TestSchemaValidations(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestSchemaValidations, self).setUp() self.schema_validator = validators.SchemaValidator(CONTAINER_CREATE) def test_create_schema_with_all_valid_parameters(self): request_to_validate = {'name': 'test1', 'image': 'nginx', 'command': '/bin/sh', 'cpu': 1.0, 'memory': '2G', 'workdir': '/workdir', 'hostname': 'container1', 'image_pull_policy': 'never'} self.schema_validator.validate(request_to_validate) def test_create_schema_image_missing(self): request_to_validate = {'name': 'test1'} self.assertRaises(exception.SchemaValidationError, self.schema_validator.validate, request_to_validate) def test_create_schema_invalid_name(self): invalid_names = ['a@', 'a', "", '*' * 265, " ", " ", "a b", 'ab@'] for value in invalid_names: request_to_validate = {'name': value, 'image': 'nginx'} self.assertRaises(exception.SchemaValidationError, self.schema_validator.validate, request_to_validate) def test_create_schema_invalid_memory(self): invalid_memory = ['2KG', 2.2, 'G2', '2.2G', '2L'] for value in invalid_memory: request_to_validate = {'memory': value, 'image': 'nginx'} self.assertRaises(exception.SchemaValidationError, self.schema_validator.validate, request_to_validate)

commit_message:
Move Mistral service to authtoken

Support for authtoken has landed in puppet-mistral, and is favored.
This migrates the templates to use authtoken.

Change-Id: I6a2cb3b7fc52786dd2647904482b173059ee03c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/50/412450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mistral::keystone::authtoken::project_name: 'service' mistral::keystone::authtoken::password: {get_param: MistralPassword} mistral::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneInternal, uri] } mistral::keystone::authtoken::auth_url: { get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneAdmin, uri_no_suffix] }
deleted_lines: mistral::keystone_password: {get_param: MistralPassword} mistral::keystone_tenant: 'service' mistral::auth_uri: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneInternal, uri]} mistral::identity_uri: {get_param: [EndpointMap, KeystoneAdmin, uri_no_suffix]}

commit_message:
Fix the flicker of the log on button name

A log on button name in horizon depends on auth_type.
This patch will fix it so as to be displayed without a flicker
after evaluation is finished.

Change-Id: I174716651ea2f4ac894c7dd5d52e5f57fe8be06a
Closes-Bug: #1627560

commit_message:
Amphora-agent should log to a distinct location

This patch sets up a seperate log file for the amphora-agent
and logrotate to manage this new log.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia7b057642d7a567d685d989d1c689d5f3481e73e

commit_message:
Enable undercloud ssl on all OVB jobs

For some reason this gets us past the testenv hangs that we're
currently seeing in the ha and updates jobs.

Change-Id: Ib9d85f09c82a301fb5fd27b753013e9897fe6a73
Partial-Bug: 1649742

added_lines: # TODO(bnemec): OVB jobs are failing without undercloud ssl right now. When we've # figured out the problem, remove this so we go back to testing both with and # without undercloud ssl. UNDERCLOUD_SSL=1

commit_message:
The handling of errors in resize_fs mask the underlying issue

When re-raising the exception as a GuestError, make sure we
communicate what actually failed.

Change-Id: I94ca826179737bb9c6aa320b97ec26e1e4198e9e
Closes-Bug: #1651213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/80/412580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except ProcessExecutionError as r: "InvalidDevicePath(path=%(path)s): %(value)s") % { "path": self.device_path, "value": r.value}) except ProcessExecutionError as r: "Error resizing the filesystem (%(path)s): %(value)s") % { "path": self.device_path, "value": r.value}) except ProcessExecutionError as r: "Error setting readhead size (%(path)s): %(value)s.") % { "path": self.device_path, "value": r.value})
deleted_lines: except ProcessExecutionError: "InvalidDevicePath(path=%s)") % self.device_path) except ProcessExecutionError: "Error resizing the filesystem: %s") % self.device_path) except ProcessExecutionError: "Error setting readhead size: %s.") % self.device_path)

commit_message:
Skip 0.13.1 version of docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs
when it tries to build docs with remote images. This has been reported
upstream[0]. The version matches the supported docutils versions for
sphinx. The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/

Change-Id: I0474d25b2d936c48c947bc78217af5a648b22f60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-cloud-config refs/changes/44/410944/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix queue names

The zuul code only accepts job names, not a regex, for the job name
to name a queue using the queue-name option.

Fix the two usages of queue-name so that the queues are properly named.

Change-Id: I3741ae7f0504b157257a0d1e35dce8ea05562adf

commit_message:
Fix existing tarball-base for openstack-ansible-os_ironic

Since the validation check was added, existing releases for
OpenStack-Ansible will cause failues due to existing reference in the
openstack-ansible-os_ironic repository, that points to
openstack-ansible-ironic incorrectly.

Change-Id: I003508a59b3e38182d672a36745a7254dbc2f1bf

commit_message:
Add debugging tests guide

Based on:

  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

Change-Id: I102d20a92c9ee709be7f0ce20c3a6b459f7802e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/22/410122/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Debugging Python Unit Tests =========================== You can debug tests with pdb. To begin, insert ``set_trace()`` where you wish to break:: import pdb; pdb.set_trace() If testr is in tox.ini, the ``testtools.run`` command should be used to run tests. However, to a `bug`_, it is not possible to simply pass a regex to this tool. Instead, first generate a list of tests to run and then pipe this list through ``testtools.run``:: $ source .tox/py27/bin/activate $ testr list-tests test_name_regex > my-list $ python -m testtools.run discover --load-list my-list Alternatively, some projects provide a ``debug`` in their tox envlist, which is based on `oslo_debug_helper`_. Run individual tests with pdb enabled with the following syntax:: $ tox -e debug -- path.to.module.Class.test .. TODO(stephenfin): How to debug nose tests? .. _`pdb`: https://docs.python.org/3/library/pdb.html .. _`bug`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/testrepository/+bug/902881 .. _`oslo_debug_helper`: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

commit_message:
trivial: Resolve some issues with Python guide

- Precede commands with '$'
- Clarify some language

Change-Id: Ib71b7fffc494a44c73ffb76145cfecab5d138a1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/21/410121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ pip install bindep $ sudo [apt-get | yum] install $(bindep -b)The tests available and the tools used to implement these tests vary from project to project. This section assumes you have all system dependencies needed by the project installed. It covers how to run the style check and unit tests. Both are run through `tox`_, so you need to install it:: $ sudo pip install tox $ tox .. note:: Completing this command may take a long time, depending on system resources. You might not see any output until tox is complete.tox will run your entire test suite in the environments specified in the $ tox -e <env> $ tox -e py27 $ tox -e pep8 $ tox -e <env> -- path.to.module.Class.test $ tox -e py27 -- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_claims.ClaimTestCase.test_memory_unlimited $ tox -e <env> -- --tests path.to.module:Class.test $ tox -e py27 -- --tests test.unit.container.test_backend:TestContainerBroker.test_empty
deleted_lines: pip install bindep sudo [apt-get | yum] install $(bindep -b)This section assumes you have all system dependencies needed by the project installed. It covers how to run the style check and unit tests. Both are run through `tox`_, so you need to install it:: pip install tox tox Note: Completing this command may take a long time (depends on system resources), also you might not see any output until tox is complete. Tox will run your entire test suite in the environments specified in the tox -e <env> tox -e py27 tox -e pep8 tox -e <env> -- path.to.module.Class.test tox -e py27 -- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_claims.ClaimTestCase.test_memory_unlimited tox -e <env> -- --tests path.to.module:Class.test tox -e py27 -- --tests test.unit.container.test_backend:TestContainerBroker.test_empty

commit_message:
Skip network verification for bonds in round robin mode

Bond interfaces with 'balance-rr' mode are now skipped by network
verification task for bootstrap nodes as network checker does not
support this type of bonding.

Change-Id: I39b2c5916fd6f39548af0e41d8e7f877983f73a2
Closes-Bug: #1546520
(cherry picked from commit 5c3ed6ef0f6636d4b6d274f179dacec27a370b3c)

Only interfaces of successfully' \ ' deployed nodes may be checked with LACP' \ ' enabled. commit_message:
Create symlink which is required for master node plugin tasks

Place where plugins are linked depends on configuration (of Nailgun,
MCollective, Astute), hence must not be hardcoded in specs and
should be done by puppet manifests which own master node configuration
details.

Change-Id: I1e9db92f9fc8dc70403113d1d6f9062b689dd2ee
Related-bug: #1603987
Closes-bug: #1648882
(cherry picked from commit 0bb6ffbcb5ee6734fcf5dfd5f4dca20a5caa3b88)

added_lines: # NOTE(eli): In order for plugins to be run on master node # without a need to hardcode full path, create a symlink # so Nailgun can set CWD during execution of plugin tasks. file {'/etc/fuel/plugins': ensure => link, target => '/var/www/nailgun/plugins', }

commit_message:
Enable show_multiple_loations option for glance when using Ceph

When using Ceph as storage backend, to take the benefit of Ceph
inside snapshot, show_multiple_locations option needs to be enabled
so image snapshot can be done using ceph clone.

Change-Id: I8ecfcbd7b0df518f5dcf046693203bd7815efbb2
Closes-Bug: #1641572
(cherry picked from commit 220566bf6d2ad740bc55e35b7e559d60e17ef5f2)

python-apps element

commit_message:
Deprecate putting periodic tasks on a driver object

This approach will no longer make sense when the driver composition is in effect.
Anyway usually a better place to put a task is an interface.

Change-Id: I7096e428ce9774d89ac624c2d38bb23984a4b842
Related-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
The driver composition reform

This spec suggests revamping how we name and compose drivers from interfaces.
It will allow having one vendor driver with options configurable per node
instead of many drivers for every vendor.

Partial-Bug: 1524745
Change-Id: I2754f9bb810f5e05a9c1e4625afb8f2589eeef74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/70/188370/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Driver Composition Reform ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/driver-composition-reform This spec suggests revamping how we name and compose drivers from interfaces. It will allow having one vendor driver with options configurable per node instead of many drivers for every vendor. Problem description =================== Our driver interface matrix becomes more and more complex. To top it all, nowadays we have many interfaces that can be used for every driver. To name a few (assuming boot-deploy separation lands): * ``boot``: most drivers support PXE and iPXE, while some also support virtual media. * ``deploy``: old bash-based ramdisk and new agent ramdisk are supported by all drivers. * ``inspect``: there is generic inspection using ironic-inspector, but some drivers allow also out-of-band inspection. Proposed change =============== On the Vancouver Summit we observed (see etherpad_) that the only interfaces that are really bound to a driver and can't be reasonably changed are ``power`` and ``management``. This spec proposes redefining a driver as power + management interface with other interfaces being changeable by an operator. Actual changes are as follows: * For every changeable interface, enhance the base driver with a new dict ``allowed_%(interface)s`` providing mappings from interface names to interface implementation instance. * Change how we load drivers: instead of one singleton instance of a driver, we'll have an instance per node, so that we can change interface attributes. * Allow node ``driver_info`` to contain ``%(interface)s_interface`` fields, overriding default interface implementation for every changeable interface. * Create new set of drivers with clear names and extensible interfaces, e.g.: ``drac``, ``ilo``, ``ipmitool``, etc. Allow vendors decide which interface implementations should be default for their drivers, but make sure all possible combinations are listed in ``allowed_%(interface)s`` for the driver. * Modify driver-specific periodic tasks code to also collect periodic tasks for *possible* interfaces of every driver. .. _etherpad: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-ironic-driver-composition

commit_message:
Setting up a development env with devstack instructions

Adds instructions on how to set up a fully functional manila
development environment using Devstack to the Developers Reference.

Partially-implements bp improve-manila-developer-docs

Change-Id: Id9781046716af2e04a0aea2734fbe4590bfd28dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/75/408275/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. All Rights Reserved. not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Setting Up a Development Environment with Devstack ================================================== This page describes how to setup a working development environment that can be used in deploying Manila on latests releases of Ubuntu or Fedora. These instructions assume you're already familiar with git. Refer to GettingTheCode_ for additional information. .. _GettingTheCode: http://wiki.openstack.org/GettingTheCode Following these instructions will allow you to have a fully functioning Manila environment using the Devstack project (a documented shell script to build complete OpenStack development environments). Manila ------ Manila can be easily enabled in Devstack by using the plug-in based interface it offers. Start by cloning the Devstack repository in your local home folder. :: git clone https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack Change to ~/devstack directory :: cd ~/devstack Copy the local.conf sample file to the upper level directory :: cp sample/local.conf ../ Enable the Manila plugin adding the following line to the end of the local.conf file :: enable_plugin manila https://github.com/openstack/manila Run the stack.sh script :: ./stack.sh After it finish running, you should have Manila services running. You can check this by attaching to the screen :: screen -r stack And navigating to the Manila tabs (use alt+a n, alt+a p, alt+a " <number of screen> to navigate tabs, alt+a esc to set the focus on the current screen and alt+a to detach from the screen). Manila UI --------- In order to use the Manila UI you will need to enable the plugin separately. This is done in a similar fashion than enabling Manila for Devstack. Make sure you have Horizon enabled (enabled by default in current Devstack). Then, enable the Manila UI plugin adding the following line to the end of the local.conf file, just after Manila plugin enablement :: enable_plugin manila-ui https://github.com/openstack/manila-ui Run the stack.sh script :: ./stack.sh After it finish running, you should have Manila services running and you should be able to access Manila UI from the dashboard. .. note:: If you had previously ran ./stack.sh when deploying Manila and you are enabling Manila UI, you have to ./unstack.sh and ./stack.sh again in order to pick up the enablement of Manila UI.

commit_message:
Add lock action record

The aim of this feature it to record lock/unlock action for audit, it
allow admin user to query who/when lock the server from action list.
In addition, this also make up the `locked_by` field which only store
"admin" or "owner", this feature can query user id from action list.

Change-Id: I44b1c7727e729aaff5da2be708801ba7e6635d55
Implements: blueprint add-lock-action-record
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/34/397034/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Add lock/unlock action record ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-lock-action-record The aim of this feature it to record lock/unlock action for audit, it allow admin user to query who/when lock the server from action list. In addition, this also make up the `locked_by` field which only store "admin" or "owner", this feature can query user id from action list. Problem description =================== We can show most of action on the server in current version, it's very useful for audit, but what a pity is that we can't show lock actions. we can't track the real user who lock a server via Nova API in current veresion API. Use Cases --------- It is same as other actions use case. Sometimes a admin user want to known who/when lock their servers. Proposed change =============== Append lock and unlock action to `instance_actions.py`. Append `record_action_start` after lock or unlock operation executes sucessfully. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: int32bit Work Items ---------- * Add logic to implement record lock and unlock action * Add nova functional tests * Add tempest tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add the following tests. * Unit tests * Functional tests * Tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== * API Reference * CLI Reference * Admin User Guide on instnace action/event list topic. References ========== * [1] add lock/unlock action record - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-lock-action-record History ======= * Locking/Unlocking server support. * get-lock-status-of-instance is in pending approval status.

commit_message:
Correct fake V3 token responses

A V3 token always contains audit_ids.

The V3 token catalog has region_id in addition to region (region
is deprecated).

Also, the V3 token has password_expires_at in the user.

See http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html?expanded=password-authentication-with-scoped-authorization-detail

Change-Id: I426cf216cf6a8e348e6f0343e0f71b9766919f60

commit_message:
Propagate remaining time to job

We want to know within a job how much time remained before zuul
finishes the job. For local preparements and end job tasks.

Change-Id: Ib4c7df73efaca42db30c56a8d1eb3b790b86cb99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/82/412082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export REMAINING_TIME=$((DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT - elapsed - 5))

commit_message:
Show non-owner project servers

This feature adds the possibility to show a server which is not
current context project if permitted. The proposal is to add a new
flag ``--all-tenants`` in ``nova show`` subcommand. If ``--all-tenants``
is set to ``True``, we will find a server from all projects by id or
name.

bp show-server-all-tenants

Change-Id: I01859fa4694e1c88192447d04c5d52e53e48ad8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/29/397329/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================================== Show non-owner project servers ===================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+spec/show-server-all-tenants This feature adds the possibility to show a server which is not current context project if permitted. The proposal is to add a new flag ``--all-tenants`` in ``nova show`` subcommand. If ``--all-tenants`` is set to ``True``, we will find a server from all projects by id or name. Problem description =================== We can define a role policy that can list all servers from all tenants like: os_compute_api:servers:detail:get_all_tenants": "is_admin:True or role:myrole" It's very useful to define a readonly admin user that can show any server but can't do action on it. Currently we can list all servers using ``--all-tenants`` flags but there is no way to show a server we list. It seems inconsistent and weird. We can just add a ``--all-tenants`` as well to ``nova show``, If this flag present, we will try to retrieve the server from all projects. Use Cases --------- The use case for End Users is to show a server they can list. Proposed change =============== The scope of the change: * new flag ``--all-tenants`` in the ``nova show`` subcommand * all docs related to ``nova show`` topic Alternatives ------------ The ``ALL_TENANTS`` os environment which affect the default value of ``--all-tenants``. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- End users can provide a ``--all-tenants`` flag when execute a ``nova show`` command to retrive the server from all projects. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: int32bit Work Items ---------- * Add new arg ``--all-tenants`` to ``do_show`` function in ``shell.py`` * Add logic to find a server from all servers by name or id in ``find_resource`` * adjust novaclient unit test Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Show a non-owner project server with policy pass * Show a non-owner project server without policy pass * Show a non-existing server Documentation Impact ==================== http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/nova.html CLI doc will be updated to include the new option ``--all-tenants`` in ``nova show`` References ========== None History =======

commit_message:
Remove extra 'u' from cli output

The unicode_key_value_to_string() function is designed to remove
extra 'u' in cinderclient cli output.
However this patch[1] bring the extra 'u' back.
Let's remove the extra 'u' again.

Closes-bug: #1615921
Closes-bug: #1606904

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/342734/
Change-Id: I26f0ad7149f57e935953c2398ba90b7b3585e201
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/04/347804/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _encode(src): if isinstance(src, unicode): return src.encode('utf-8') return src return _encode(dictionary) return dict((_encode(k), _encode(unicode_key_value_to_string(v)))

commit_message:
Add memcached_servers for keystone authtoken

This change adds the abiltity to manage the memcached servers for the
keystone authtoken configuration in ceilometer::api

Change-Id: I5fe1ec35630a67fe08b5c7b475593c34044110e8
(cherry picked from commit 1ae57a6e789b0bb2f4abe01c8d2314cca776edb9)

added_lines: is_expected.to contain_ceilometer_config('keystone_authtoken/memcached_servers').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') context 'with memcached servers' do before do params.merge!({ :memcached_servers => '1.1.1.1:11211', }) end it 'configures ceilometer-api service' do is_expected.to contain_ceilometer_config('keystone_authtoken/memcached_servers').with_value('1.1.1.1:11211') end end

commit_message:
move the undercloud deploy role from quickstart to quickstart-extras

In an effort to make more of the tripleo deployment ci more composable
it has been discussed to break out the undercloud deployment into it's
own role.  There are examples where additional configuration is needed
prior to the undercloud installation such as dpdk, and installing in
other ci environments.

Change-Id: I87fec6435f84490b9f9de8d2cc0dd9f186409d4d

commit_message:
Add release notes and an error message for release

In prepping for 1.14.0, it seemed there were a couple of important
release notes missing, as well as an informative error message
in case someone installs shade fresh and then tries to use
glance_client.

Change-Id: I17b8e7d3d1f6ac8172e49f4473137f51351f7e5d

Additionally, you may want to use' ' make_legacy_client from os_client_config for this purpose' ' instead.') raise

commit_message:
Add Dict and List as valid value types in String()

This patch overrides the String() field in order to accept list and
dict as valid value types for any DictOfStringsField type field.

Change-Id: Ia7d726b438f0ec9deeb797bf0dd1e438e05881ef
Closes-Bug: 1648560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/39/408739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance(value, list): return six.text_type(value) if isinstance(value, dict): return six.text_type(value)

commit_message:
Port libvirt.storage.test_rbd to Python 3

* Stop explicitly encoding strings we pass to rbd: the library
  supports multiple string types now.
* We mock module rbd from rbd_utils.py, also need set module rbd's
  specific exceptions with object inherit from BaseException to avoid
  TypeError like: 'TypeError: catching classes that do not inherit from
  BaseException is not allowed'

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3eec213ad9bc13f0a371a5c4f28d3df377796125

commit_message:
Fix error if free_disk_gb is None in CellStateManager

The field 'free_disk_gb' in Objects.ComputeNode can be nullable.
In CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts, we compute free_disk_mb
by 'free_disk_gb * 1024'. If the free_disk_gb is None, it will raise
a TypeError exception because None type can't multiply by an integer.
We should check this value, and if it's None, we just let it return
zero.

Closes-Bug: #1648983

Change-Id: I558d544ff838807c1d605cb5ed8d0e0fa97ab00e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/01/409501/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if compute.free_disk_gb and compute.free_disk_gb > 0: chost['free_disk_mb'] += compute.free_disk_gb * 1024

commit_message:
Detect binary output file (txt/html)

Printing out bytes values to text destination results in mangled
output. Add better detection.

Closes-bug: 1613169
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration

The upstream mistral puppet module is adding a authtoken specific class
for mistral to match all the other services. This change switches to use
the new class which should allow for proper keystone v3 support.

Change-Id: I3fd172eba736e21d52d92ddad502dee060070ca9
Depends-On: I71969ef09018f9daa5f81c4f3bcbdb0b0974446c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/78/409478/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
