commit_message:
add update_constraints.sh for use by new release job

This script is based on the existing steps in release.sh for updating
the constraints list after releasing one of our Python projects. It's
placed in its own commit so it is available on the release nodes when
the new job in the following commit is merged.

Change-Id: Ie3e6d0e3501fa0cba251e000430bd0740a2bd331
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/07/411907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Script to update the constraints file in the requirements repo when # a release is tagged. # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -x TOOLSDIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" source $TOOLSDIR/functions function usage { echo "Usage: update_constraints.sh version" echo echo "Example: update_constraints.sh 3.0.3" } if [ $# -lt 1 ]; then usage exit 2 fi VERSION=$1 # Extract the tag message by parsing the git show output, which looks # something like: # # tag 2.0.0 # Tagger: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com> # Date: Tue Dec 1 21:45:44 2015 +0000 # # python-keystoneclient 2.0.0 release # # meta:version: 2.0.0 # meta:series: mitaka # meta:release-type: release # -----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----- # Comment: GPGTools - http://gpgtools.org # # iQEcBAABAgAGBQJWXhUIAAoJEDttBqDEKEN62rMH/ihLAGfw5GxPLmdEpt7gsLJu # ... # TAG_META=$(git show --no-patch "$VERSION" | grep '^meta:' || true) if [[ -z "$TAG_META" ]]; then echo "WARNING: Missing meta lines in $VERSION tag message," echo " skipping announcement." echo echo "Was the tag for $VERSION created with release.sh?" exit 0 fi function get_tag_meta { typeset fieldname="$1" echo "$TAG_META" | grep "^meta:$fieldname:" | cut -f2 -d' ' } # Find the series information from the tag metadata in the comment. SERIES=$(get_tag_meta series) # Pick up the repository name from the git URL. SHORTNAME=$(basename $(git config --local remote.origin.url)) # Apply the PEP 503 rules to turn the dist name into a canonical form, # in case that's the version that appears in upper-constraints.txt. We # have to try substituting both versions because we have a mix in that # file and if we rename projects we'll end up with bad references to # existing build artifacts. function pep503 { echo $1 | sed -e 's/[-_.]\+/-/g' | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' } # Try to propose a constraints update. # # NOTE(dhellmann): If the setup_requires dependencies are not # installed yet, running setuptools commands will install # them. Capturing the output of a setuptools command that includes # the output from installing packages produces a bad dist_name, so # we first ask for the name without saving the output and then we # ask for it again and save the output to get a clean # version. This is why we can't have nice things. python setup.py --name dist_name=$(python setup.py --name) canonical_name=$(pep503 $dist_name) if [[ -z "$dist_name" ]]; then echo "Could not determine the name of the constraint to update" else setup_temp_space update-constraints-$SHORTNAME # NOTE(dhellmann): zuul-cloner defaults to checking out master if # the named branch doesn't exist. clone_repo openstack/requirements stable/$SERIES cd openstack/requirements git checkout -b "$dist_name-$VERSION" sed -e "s/^${dist_name}=.*/$dist_name===$VERSION/" --in-place upper-constraints.txt sed -e "s/^${canonical_name}=.*/$canonical_name===$VERSION/" --in-place upper-constraints.txt if git commit -a -m "update constraint for $dist_name to new release $VERSION $TAG_META "; then git show git review -t 'new-release' else echo "Skipping git review because there are no updates." fi fi exit 0

commit_message:
Move postgresql gates to experimental stage

Moving new postgresql gates to experimental stage.
There are issues which were not predicted in local
development stage. Having gates NV means longer check
time for each change which is not desired until
problems are fixed.

Also removed postgresql based gates from other monasca
projects apart from monasca-api

Change-Id: I3b1710464a487e985e2473d963dc5eed398b6e71

commit_message:
Switch to openSUSE Leap 42.2 release by default

openSUSE 13.1 was discontinued on Feb 3rd, 2016, so defaulting
to it doesn't make sense (see https://en.opensuse.org/Lifetime).

Leap 42.2 is the most current release that is supported by
disk-image-builder and being tested in a 3rd party ci.

Enable functests for it to ensure we're not regressing again.
Moved to non-voting gate first.

Depends-On: Iff495b3cd0b6c3558c44cf4883651eca67b572d6
Change-Id: Iae6cd34a5853f1e309861c554d94d8595cbd9993

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-16 12:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a84b3893c47ef1e986fc3f04870248572406c9dd', 'message': 'Fix python-heatclient docs publishing

Change-Id: Ia30ed578efdd3ea9d8b9f2ef37afc5d07f88dcb5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python-heatclient docs publishing

heatclient was only publishing docs in release pipeline but used the
wrong macro - use the proper template for it so that publishing works.

If publishing happens only in release pipepline, the tags-only jobs
(used by client publish template) needs to be used to have content at
top-level as well.

Change-Id: Ia30ed578efdd3ea9d8b9f2ef37afc5d07f88dcb5

commit_message:
Fix usage of NotImplementedError

'NotImplementedError' is the name of an exception, 'NotImplemented' is
the name of a constant. This patch fixes the usage.

Change-Id: If6293e1644a4c95d27114b2c28a2a264f65c330a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/65/412165/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return NotImplementedError

parse request object.

added_lines: obj = util.parse_request('ProfileTypeListRequest', req, {}) obj = util.parse_request( 'ProfileTypeGetRequest', req, {'type_name': type_name})
deleted_lines: import jsonschema import six from webob import exc from senlin.objects import base as obj_base from senlin.objects.requests import profile_type as vorp try: norm_req = obj_base.SenlinObject.normalize_req( 'ProfileTypeListRequest', {}) obj = vorp.ProfileTypeListRequest.obj_from_primitive(norm_req) jsonschema.validate(norm_req, obj.to_json_schema()) except ValueError as ex: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(six.text_type(ex)) try: norm_req = obj_base.SenlinObject.normalize_req( 'ProfileTypeGetRequest', {'type_name': type_name}) obj = vorp.ProfileTypeGetRequest.obj_from_primitive(norm_req) jsonschema.validate(norm_req, obj.to_json_schema()) except ValueError as ex: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(six.text_type(ex)) except jsonschema.exceptions.ValidationError as ex: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(six.text_type(ex.message))

Since Atlanta, we have held the training before every " "OpenStack Summit. Besides this \"official\" event, some user groups hold the " "local Upstream trainings." msgstr "" "Kami mengadakan OpenStack Upstream Training yang pertama di Atlanta, sebelum " "OpenStack Summit Atlanta 2014. Sejak Atlanta, kami telah mengadakan " "pelatihan sebelum setiap OpenStack Summit. Selain itu acara \"official\", " "beberapa kelompok pengguna mengadakan pelatihan Upstream lokal." msgid "We will install an IRC program called Hexchat." msgstr "Kami akan menginstal program IRC disebut Hexchat." msgid "We'll install an IRC program called Colloquy." msgstr "Kami akan menginstal program IRC disebut Colloquy." msgid "" "We've designed a training program to share knowledge about the different " "ways of contributing to OpenStack like providing new features, writing " "documentation, participating in working groups, and so forth. The " "educational program is built on the principle of open collaboration and will " "teach the students how to find information and navigate the intricacies of " "the projects technical tools and social interactions in order to get their " "contributions accepted. The live one and a half day class is focusing on " "hands-on practice like the students can use a prepared development " "environment to learn how to test, prepare and upload new code snippets or " "documentation for review. The attendees are also given the opportunity to " "join a mentoring program to get further help and guidance on their journey " "to become an active and successful member of the OpenStack community." msgstr "" "Kami telah merancang program pelatihan untuk berbagi pengetahuan tentang " "cara-cara yang berbeda berkontribusi untuk OpenStack seperti menyediakan " "fitur baru, menulis dokumentasi, berpartisipasi dalam kelompok kerja, dan " "sebagainya. Program pendidikan ini dibangun di atas prinsip kolaborasi " "terbuka dan akan mengajarkan siswa bagaimana untuk menemukan informasi dan " "menavigasi seluk-beluk alat teknis proyek dan interaksi sosial dalam rangka " "untuk mendapatkan kontribusi mereka diterima. Kelas langsung satu dan " "setengah hari berfokus pada thands-on practice seperti siswa dapat " "menggunakan lingkungan pengembangan siap untuk belajar bagaimana untuk " "menguji, mempersiapkan dan meng-upload potongan kode baru atau dokumentasi " "untuk ulasan. Para peserta juga diberi kesempatan untuk mengikuti program " "mentoring untuk mendapatkan bantuan lebih lanjut dan bimbingan dalam " "perjalanan mereka untuk menjadi anggota aktif dan sukses dari komunitas " "OpenStack." "When you login to the server for the first time with your nickname, its " "being used by you, but it's still not registered yet." msgstr "" "Ketika Anda login ke server untuk pertama kalinya dengan nama julukan Anda, " "yang sedang digunakan oleh Anda, tetapi masih belum terdaftar." msgid ""msgid "" "With over 2000 developers from 80 different companies worldwide, OpenStack " "is one of the largest collaborative software-development projects. subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 02:16:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/renderspec/commit/a6ca2a717fa963ea5aaed436015f83602c5e2bdc', 'message': "Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

OpenStack now has dropped support for python 2.6 and lower.
So we don't need to define an assertDictEqual() for python
lower than 2.7. In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts. So is assertEqual()
in testtools. assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict,
list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I26752d6743b04cf43eba7a9d3fd97cae08d10c47
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-19 02:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/renderspec/commit/b1fa8a6d650f1202a4b330d167fb8694ddabe7cb', 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts. So is assertEqual()
in testtools. assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict,
list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I26752d6743b04cf43eba7a9d3fd97cae08d10c47
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts. So is assertEqual()
in testtools. assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict,
list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I26752d6743b04cf43eba7a9d3fd97cae08d10c47

commit_message:
[WIP]Clean useless tables in Tricircle after spliting

1. What is the problem?
Tricircle now is dedicated for networking automation across Neutron. Some
tables used in APIs gateway should be removed, like aggregation table, pod
binding table, etc. They should not reside in the Tricircle any more. Other
tables containing old meanings but still in use should be renamed for better
understanding.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The data models, tables and APIs about aggregation, pod binding, etc. should
be removed. After the pod binding table is removed, the az_hint used for
external network creation is hard to match. So special handle needs to be
implemented. Other tables will have vague meaning after this spliting, but they
still take effective in the Tricircle, So they should be renamed for better
understanding.
  1)Tables to be removed:
    *aggregates
    *aggregate_metadata
    *instance_types
    *instance_type_projects
    *instance_type_extra_specs
    *key_pairs
    *pod_binding
  2)Tables need to be renamed:
    *cascaded_pod_service_configuration (new name: cached_endpoints)
    *cascaded_pods (new name: pods)
    *cascaded_pods_resource_routing (new name: resource_routings)
    *job (new name: async_jobs)

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
After the pod binding table is removed, the az_hint used for external
network creation is hard to match. New features will be implemented to solve
this problem.

Change-Id: I602f6aada2eae5e09dbf9f36da3b184c6e98baf8

Reason: 
# source openrc admin admin

OS_USERNAME=admin

But when there is a new tenant:tenant_tom,user_tom/password_tom

The OS_PASSWORD is still ADMIN_PASSWORD not password_tom,

commit_message:
Add an extra argument for password in openrc

Reason:
# source openrc admin admin
OS_TENANT_NAME=admin
OS_USERNAME=admin
OS_PASSWORD =ADMIN_PASSWORD
But when there is a new tenant:tenant_tom,user_tom/password_tom
# source openrc user_tom tenant_tom
OS_TENANT_NAME=tenant_tom
OS_USERNAME=user_tom
OS_PASSWORD =ADMIN_PASSWORD
The OS_PASSWORD is still ADMIN_PASSWORD not password_tom,
and it will report "ERROR (Unauthorized): The request you have made
requires authentication"

Change-Id: I0caf7ca49671120521a2d7e595ca6a8995f58a8c
Closes-Bug: #1635198

commit_message:
Make some py35 voting (openstack/[a-d]*)

py35 is passing for these projects, make it voting:

* app-catalog, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411162/
* barbican, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/351406/
* ceilometer-powervm, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/405641/
* charms.ceph, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408187/
* charms.openstack, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411430/
* cloudkitty, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393021/
* cloudkitty-dashboard, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410084/
* compute-hyperv, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/400120/
* cursive, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/378156/
* delimiter, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/361286/
* django_openstack_auth, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389337/
* dragonflow, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410645/

Also, remove definition of non-voting py35 job for diskimage-builder,
it's unused.

Change-Id: I83218eddc2705d310a9ebe99deb1fc611043509f

commit_message:
Introduce role-specific nova-server-metadata

We could already pass metadata to the nova server instances (on
creation) via the ServerMetadata parameter, however, there was no
way of doing this per-role. This introduces that by adding a
{{role}}ServerMetadata parameter for each role. This parameter gets
merged with the ServerMetadata parameter and allows this
functionality.

Note that both default to {}, and so does the result of merging those
parameters with their default values. So nothing changes for the
default settings.

Change-Id: I334edcc51ce7ee82fc13b6cf4c0d74ccb7db099c

commit_message:
openstack-infra/* make py35 voting

Make py35 jobs voting if they pass:

* reviewstats, see https://review.openstack.org/412117
* storyboard, see https://review.openstack.org/390983

These are the only openstack-infra repos with non-voting jobs.

Change-Id: I30bbfebc93371e344d99f0088f92ab58ac3a413a

commit_message:
Remove z/tempest

Change I3749f88edd1984286f9cfc840bfe37722b2f28be moved the comment for
z/tempest away from it. Remove it.

Remove z/tempest completely, with just a single job in it, it's useless
- and not needed anymore.

The current job to name the integrated queue is for a newton only
change, use another job from the integrated gate to name the queue.

Change-Id: I138c7c39d0dcf2e65f00f34cbb160ab0d5b49813
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/65/411965/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is not strictly necessary; there is currently a transitive # relationship between g-t-dsvm, # g-t-dsvm-{postgres,cinder,neutron} and g-t-dsvm-full # that will ensure that these projects end up in the same shared # change queue, however, this fake project makes it explicit that # g-t-dsvm and g-t-dsvm-full must share a change # queue, which should protect against accidental queue divorce in # case jobs get moved around. Since g-t-dsvm-full is a # superset of g-t-dsvm, the whole set of projects is still # gated on g-t-dsvm.

commit_message:
Trusty/py34 cleanup, part5

With py34 and trusty jobs now running only on stable/mitaka, cleanup
some projects:

These projects have only a master branch, remove trusty
and py34 jobs:
* rack
* rally
* refstack-client
* reno (has master and newton)
* sahara-tests
* security-analysis
* stacklight-integration-tests
* stacktach-*
* swift-bench
* swift-ceph-backend
* tempest
* tempest-horizon
* tosca-parser
* tripleo-incubator (has master and newton
  as well as inactive icehouse (confirmed by Emilien) branches
* vitrage (has master and newton)
* watcher (has master and newton)

These projects have only master branch (or newton and newer), remove
trusty and py34 jobs and make py35 voting since it passes:
* renderspec, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410844/
* requests-mock, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/407770/
* scalpels, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402075/
* shaker, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410706/
* stackalytics, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411886/
* surveil - has no recent submissions
* tempest-lib, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402525/
* vitrage-dashboard (has master and newton), see
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404040/
* watcher-dashboard, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411361/
* wsme - has no recent submissions
* zun, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411125/

Change-Id: Ic584c64d518303e2df467aadc3c99e91b733e59e

commit_message:
Trusty/py34 cleanup, part4

With py34 and trusty jobs now running only on
stable/mitaka, cleanup some projects:

These projects have only a master branch, remove trusty and py34 jobs:
* mistral-lib
* networking-ovn (has master and newton branches)
* neutron-dynamic-routing (has master and newton branches)
* openstack-health
* os-apply-config (has master and newton branches)

commit_message:
Enable SECURE_PROXY_SSL_HEADER option for horizon

This reads makes Django take the X-Forwarded-Proto header into account
when forming URLs.

Change-Id: Ice64de9a11d7819ae7f380279ff356342d9b6673
Depends-On: Ifed7d4c3409419c01c5b20c707221c1fc76ea09e

commit_message:
Raise ValueError if a config section does not exist

Instead of printing the error message and
calling sys.exit() when a section not exists
or reading the file failed rais an Exception
from readconfig. Depending on the Value or IO-Error,
the caller can decide if he wants to exit or continue.
If an Exception reaches the wsgi utilities
it bubbles all the way up.

Change-Id: Ieb444f8c34e37f49bea21c3caf1c6c2d7bee5fb4
Closes-Bug: 1578321

[Generic driver] Fix generation of admin export location

For managed and created from snapshot shares.

Change-Id: I6e7eca54725d1aef994d617f253e73909a9d8303
Closes-Bug: #1646097

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-21 17:46:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/552fe03bcb203001cdbf8082dd2af9055cb440d2', 'message': "Add pykube to global-requirements

pykube [0] is more concrete Python client library for Kubernetes that
fuel-ccp have switched to. It's well-maintained and have good license.

Questionnaire:

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, see [0] above.

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, it's the best Python client for Kubernetes we could find. It
  contains all necessary abstractions and is easy to use.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes. It has regular test runs for Python 3.3-3.5

- Is the library license compatible?

  It's Apache 2.0 license, it's compatible.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No, it's not. fuel-ccp which is it's sole user for now is not packaged
  yet either, so that won't be a problem.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  It's a replacement for python-k8sclient that doesn't suit our needs
  anymore.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  Yes, it's required for fuel-ccp. python-k8sclient misses some features
  (last time it was rolling update iirc) that we use and implementing
  them on top of autogenerated code is hard.
  pykube is an alternative from outer world that contains all necessary
  features and is easy to extend.

[0] https://github.com/kelproject/pykube

Change-Id: If037019d2cdcc72ec151794dd2eb827b6db3daa6

commit_message:
Add pykube to global-requirements

pykube [0] is more concrete Python client library for Kubernetes that
fuel-ccp have switched to. It's well-maintained and have good license.

Questionare:

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, see [0] above.

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, it's the best Python client for Kubernetes we could find. It
  contains all necessary abstractions and is easy to use.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes. It has regular test runs for Python 3.3-3.5

- Is the library license compatible?

  It's Apache 2.0 license, it's compatible.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No, it's not. fuel-ccp which is it's sole user for now is not packaged
  yet either, so that won't be a problem.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  It's a replacement for python-k8sclient that doesn't suit our needs
  anymore.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  Yes, it's required for fuel-ccp. python-k8sclient misses some features
  (last time it was rolling update iirc) that we use and implementing
  them on top of autogenerated code is hard.
  pykube is an alternative from outer world that contains all necessary
  features and is easy to extend.

[0] https://github.com/kelproject/pykube

Change-Id: If037019d2cdcc72ec151794dd2eb827b6db3daa6

commit_message:
Fix DVR gate job breakage

The Neutron DVR gate jobs are broken due to commit
7fac6b68380f3f0ce44eefd257e571844a8b741d. Add an empty 'neutron-dvr'
entry in the 'primary' section of features.yaml

Also add logging on what the features have been set to.

Change-Id: I7f57de5d43f6943863b1df3e2c367587b519fc05

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 06:15:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/85ece484b01dc65612a070c89e4284d4eaed54ab', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor VIF plugging and attach

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 21:20:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/df90d7d8a5cccb2573f96167f302c798b281dac0', 'message': 'Refactor VIF plugging and attaching code

This is the first step to offload VIF plugging code to os-vif
library. In particular, this commit moved the veth pair creation
from plug_bridge/plug_ovs_hybrid to attach. This makes more sense
because the veth pair is created for attach the VIF to container.

commit_message:
Refactor VIF plugging and attaching code

This is the first step to offload VIF plugging code to os-vif
library. In particular, this commit moved the veth pair creation
from plug_bridge/plug_ovs_hybrid to attach. This makes more sense
because the veth pair is created for attach the VIF to container.

Partial-Implements: blueprint switch-to-os-vif
Change-Id: Ieaeeeac04a0f92207c6235933ca1040da6da3ffe

added_lines: " Rolling back the network interfaces %s %s %s " % ( br_name, v1_name, v2_name) def _create_veth_pair(self, if_local_name, if_remote_name, bridge): undo_mgr = utils.UndoManager() try: utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'add', 'name', if_local_name, 'type', 'veth', 'peer', 'name', if_remote_name, run_as_root=True) undo_mgr.undo_with(lambda: utils.execute( 'ip', 'link', 'delete', if_local_name, run_as_root=True)) # NOTE(samalba): Deleting the interface will delete all # associated resources (remove from the bridge, its pair, etc...) utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'set', if_local_name, 'address', self._fe_random_mac(), run_as_root=True) utils.execute('brctl', 'addif', bridge, if_local_name, run_as_root=True) utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'set', if_local_name, 'up', run_as_root=True) except Exception: LOG.exception("Failed to configure network") msg = _('Failed to setup the network, rolling back') undo_mgr.rollback_and_reraise(msg=msg) if_local_name = 'tap%s' % vif['id'][:11] if not linux_net.device_exists(if_local_name): br_name = vif['network']['bridge'] if (vif_type == network_model.VIF_TYPE_OVS and self.ovs_hybrid_required(vif)): br_name = self.get_br_name(vif['id']) self._create_veth_pair(if_local_name, if_remote_name, br_name)
deleted_lines: if_local_name = 'tap%s' % vif['id'][:11] if_remote_name = 'ns%s' % vif['id'][:11] # Device already exists so return. if linux_net.device_exists(if_local_name): return utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'add', 'name', if_local_name, 'type', 'veth', 'peer', 'name', if_remote_name, run_as_root=True) undo_mgr.undo_with( lambda: utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'delete', if_local_name, run_as_root=True)) # Deleting/Undoing the interface will delete all # associated resources (remove from the bridge, its pair, etc...) utils.execute('brctl', 'addif', br_name, if_local_name, run_as_root=True) utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'set', if_local_name, 'up', run_as_root=True) " Rolling back the network interfaces %s %s %s %s " % ( br_name, if_local_name, v1_name, v2_name) # Device already exists so return. if linux_net.device_exists(if_local_name): return undo_mgr = utils.UndoManager() try: utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'add', 'name', if_local_name, 'type', 'veth', 'peer', 'name', if_remote_name, run_as_root=True) undo_mgr.undo_with(lambda: utils.execute( 'ip', 'link', 'delete', if_local_name, run_as_root=True)) # NOTE(samalba): Deleting the interface will delete all # associated resources (remove from the bridge, its pair, etc...) utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'set', if_local_name, 'address', self._fe_random_mac(), run_as_root=True) utils.execute('brctl', 'addif', bridge, if_local_name, run_as_root=True) utils.execute('ip', 'link', 'set', if_local_name, 'up', run_as_root=True) except Exception: LOG.exception("Failed to configure network") msg = _('Failed to setup the network, rolling back') undo_mgr.rollback_and_reraise(msg=msg, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Make ResourceTypesTests skippable

The unit test fails when the resource types panel is disabled, even
if it's skipped with unittest.skip becuase the INDEX_URL is defined
as a class property. Also, it is used once only so it doesn't need
to be defined as a variable.

Change-Id: Ib9c190ca13c791c1f72c348bef0be1f20ccd33e1

added_lines: --- version: 2.0 clone_vm: type: direct description: clone a new instance from an existed instance. 1.clone system volume 2.set the system volume to bootable 3.create a new instance from the new bootable system volume 4.clone user volumes 5.attach user volumes to the new instance input: - sys_vol_size #system volume size of the new instance - sys_vol_id #system volume id of the old cloned instance - sys_vol_name #system volume name of the new instance - vm_name #name of the new instance - flavor_ref #flavor of the new instance - user_volumes: - user_vol_size #user volume size of the new instance - user_vol_id #user volume id of the old cloned instance - user_vol_name #user volume name of the new instance tasks: clone_sys_volume: description: create a new volume from system volume workflow: clone_volume input: size: <% $.sys_vol_size %> source_volid: <% $.sys_vol_id %> name: <% $.sys_vol_name %> publish: new_sys_vol_id: <% task(clone_sys_volume).result.vol_id %> on-success: - set_volume_bootable set_volume_bootable: action: cinder.volumes_set_bootable volume=<% $.new_sys_vol_id %> flag=true on-success: - create_new_vm create_new_vm: description: create a new instance from existed system volume workflow: create_vm_from_volume input: image: "" vm_name: <% $.vm_name %> flavor_ref: <% $.flavor_ref %> block_device_mapping_v2: - source_type: "volume" destination_type: "volume" delete_on_termination: "FALSE" boot_index: "0" uuid: <% $.new_sys_vol_id %> publish: new_vm_id: <% task(create_new_vm).result.vm_id %> on-success: - clone_user_volume clone_user_volume: description: create new volumes from existed user volumes one by one with-items: user_volume in <% $.user_volumes %> workflow: clone_volume input: size: <% ($.user_volume).user_vol_size %> source_volid: <% ($.user_volume).user_vol_id %> name: <% ($.user_volume).user_vol_name %> publish: user_vol_ids: <% task(clone_user_volume).result.vol_id %> on-success: - attach_volume attach_volume: description: attach user volumes to the instance one by one with-items: vol_id in <% $.user_vol_ids %> action: nova.volumes_create_server_volume input: server_id: <% $.new_vm_id %> volume_id: <% $.vol_id %> device: null

subject: Fix bootloader element on ppc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-16 00:16:47.000000000', 'files': ['elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/9d7725b47585edf4d2276b18fd68e4ea53c46387', 'message': 'Fix bootloader element on ppc

For some reason [1] introduced -m option without ever checking that the
mapping exists. Because there is no grub-ieee1275 mapping anywhere (not
in base, not in bootloader), pkg-map fails. So stop using the mapping in
package-install of grub-ieee1275 on ppc.

There is another patch that tries to solve the same bug by adding the
mapping [2]. I think it is better to undo the breakage introduced in [1]
first, and then, if various distributions have differing names for the
package, introduce various mappings. My reasoning is that at the moment
this element is broken for all ppc64 distributions. This patch would
fix it for some (namely, Ubuntu). Then we can add mappings as tests
are done for other distributions.

[1] Ibca43173c30c2a74a73a2e2d9dd6d6d832c62694
[2] Id2b0f63a7015f883070fd59b79fd96a1c024858a

Change-Id: I8425876c26e9e416c8ce2f53a4e38d26b4208633
Closes-Bug: #1624021
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bootloader element on ppc

For some reason [1] introduced -m option without ever checking that the
mapping exists. Because there is no grub-ieee1275 mapping anywhere (not
in base, not in bootloader), pkg-map fails. So stop using the mapping in
package-install of grub-ieee1275 on ppc.

There is another patch that tries to solve the same bug by adding the
mapping [2]. I think it is better to undo the breakage introduced in [1]
first, and then, if various distributions have differing names for the
package, introduce various mappings. My reasoning is that at the moment
this element is broken for all ppc64 distributions. This patch would
fix it for some (namely, Ubuntu). Then we can add mappings as tests
are done for other distributions.

[1] Ibca43173c30c2a74a73a2e2d9dd6d6d832c62694
[2] Id2b0f63a7015f883070fd59b79fd96a1c024858a

Change-Id: I8425876c26e9e416c8ce2f53a4e38d26b4208633
Closes-Bug: #1624021

commit_message:
Intel Node Manager policies support

This spec propose support of Intel Node Manager policies
for Ironic.

Related-bug: #1526459
Change-Id: I649aff02ddd959d3de9688092ff441e1a8cef611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/57/214657/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Intel Node Manager policies support ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/intel-node-manager This blueprint adds support of power control policies via Intel Node Manager. Problem description =================== Intel Node Manager, an Intel server firmware feature, is a smart way to optimize and manage power, cooling, and compute resources in the data center. There is no support of Intel Node Manager policies for power and CPU control in Ironic. Proposed change =============== Firmware configuration interface already proposed for Ironic: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209612/ Implementation of firmware interface ``IntelNMFirmware`` for Intel Node Manager power control policies will be created. One logical device name "intel_nm" will be available. GET /v1/drivers/<driver>/firmware/intel_nm will return list of available parameters:: [ { 'name': 'policy_enabled', 'description': 'Enable policy, 0 - disabled, 1 - enabled', 'values': [0, 1], 'default': 1, 'apply_online': True }, { 'name': 'policy_trigger_type', 'description': 'Policy Trigger Type: 0 - Ignore, 1 - Inlet Temperature, 2 - Missing Power Reading, 3 - Time After Platform, 4 - Boot time policy ' 'values': [0, 1, 2, 3, 4], 'default': 0, 'apply_online': True }, { 'name': 'policy_trigger_limit', 'description': 'Policy Trigger Limit: the Inlet temperature in Celsius or time in 1/10 of second', 'default': 0, 'apply_online': True }, { 'name': 'cpu_power_correction', 'description': 'Aggressive CPU Power Correction, 0 - automatic, 1 - nonagressive, 2 - agressive.', 'values': [0, 1, 2], 'default': 0, 'apply_online': True }, { 'name': 'power_limit', 'description': 'Power Limit to be maintained in [watts]', 'apply_online': True }, { 'name': 'throttling_level', 'description': 'Throttling level of the platform in %', 'apply_online': True }, { 'name': 'cores_disabled', 'description': 'The number of physical CPU cores that should be disabled on each CPU socket', 'default': 0, 'apply_online': True }, ] Set new parameters and get current parameters JSON data corresponds to firmware configuration interface spec. Intel Node Manager policies are extension of IPMI standard. ``IntelNMFirmware`` interface should work in Ironic with ``ipmi*`` drivers and should use ``send_raw()`` method for interactions with a node. ``send_raw()`` method will be extended and should return response raw data. Other parameter notes: * Domain ID is always 00h (Entire platform). * The driver uses one Policy ID. * Policy storage is persistent. Policy lifecycle: * When user does first change of one/some of parameter(s) for a node driver creates a policy. * User may change parameters online, driver updates a policy. * The policy will be removed by ``reset_to_defaults()`` method during cleaning or zapping procedure. Alternatives ------------ Can be implemented via node vendor passthru mechanism. Data model impact ----------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- New config option ``policy_id`` will be added, it's Policy ID that the driver uses. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: yuriyz Other contributors: vdrok Work Items ---------- * Improve IPMI drivers. * Implement ``IntelNMFirmware``. * Create unit tests. * Add documentation. Dependencies ============ * Firmware configuration interface https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209612/ * Hardware with Intel NM 1.5 or above is required, feature must be enabled. Testing ======= * Unit Tests will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== * The feature will be documented. References ========== * `Intel NM specification <http://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/technical-specifications/intel-power-node-manager-v3-spec.pdf>`_ * `IPMI specification <http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/servers/ipmi/ipmi-second-gen-interface-spec-v2-rev1-1.html>`_

[devref] copy samples/local.conf correctly

Fix the command cited in the devref devstack doc to copy
samples/local.conf up one directory for use as basis for
a local.conf with manila plugin added.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Helm-entrypoint git hooks

This PS adds a place to easily add helm-entrypoint service packages
to test in the gate before we have enough to split out into its own
file. This will allow glance/cinder/nova/neutron to be tested more
easily.

Change-Id: I77fe47f891a6e1cc747b9102f8f7d4d04dc882bc

commit_message:
Add oslo_messaging_notifications transport_url

Adding the ability to configure the oslo_messaging_notifications
transport_url.

Change-Id: I55b718618d3ede8b0483bd8b4c0877339b6fc0b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/62/410862/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add the ability to configure the oslo messaging notification transport url via glance::notify::rabbit::notficiation_transport_url

Tivial:update the description format in volume_snapshot.py

Replace the old description format with "_description = _( )"

Change-Id: I36d61621309cfceefbd1ab1b930fa94b4bad2036

subject: Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 02:38:45.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient/commit/68e27da93d74e3d2868bc089f430e52f9c4979ab', 'message': 'Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I3c027c1201c011d1aaedbdb209f0c435d2097d70
'}]
commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I3c027c1201c011d1aaedbdb209f0c435d2097d70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/04/390704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py34,py27,pep8

commit_message:
revise receiver api

this patch revises receiver api to use util method to parse request
object.

Change-Id: I1efc9cf71a2eb2ddf3b0fd23cf17d11e3d9cfa4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/82/412182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
revise event API

this patch revisea event APIs to use util method to
parse request object.

Change-Id: Iad5c50f140eadab0487fb1d8a8f26104b19d8f87

commit_message:
Install dracut-generic-config package

dracut has a "hostonly" mode where it builds an initramfs that is
suitable for booting the system it is building on.  This is on by
default, but obviously in our nested multi-platform chroot situation
this is fraught with danger.

As highlighted by [1] our builds were inadvertently turning off
"hostonly" mode when the mountpoints in the chroot were not found.
The CentOS 7.3 behaviour change broke this and we ended up with an
initramfs with no file-system modules.

Iaf2a1e8470f642bfaaaad3f9b7f26cfc8cc445c9 introduced a regeneration of
the initramfs, which I think does work as described because it runs in
the loopback device.

However, dracut includes a package that installs configuration
overrides to build a generic initramfs.  This is really what we want,
and should solve the problem no matter where the initramfs is created.

Add this package into yum-minimal and remove the extra re-create call
which should not be necessary.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1405238

Change-Id: I5d203f2abe743cb23a44d449850e692a948e7871

commit_message:
api-ref: replace 'osapi_max_limit' with 'max_limit'

The 'osapi_max_limit' has been renamed to 'max_limit'
since Ida4ee57d6e1822e35e3198f6d3a89410e211d57d.
So replace 'osapi_max_limit' with 'max_limit'
in the API reference.

Change-Id: I8d7de5f5181cb399352ef1ede505c3b3742f7338
Closes-Bug: #1650999

commit_message:
Fix status after a VolumeDriverException

If a driver raised VolumeDriverException during failover_host then the
service would remain in "failing-over" replication status and we would
see an AttributeError exception in the logs.

That is because we were trying to set the "status" field in a service,
and that field doesn't exist.

This patch fixes this by setting the replication_status field to error
instead and by disabling the service.

We had no failover_host manager tests, and this patch doesn't try to add
all the tests that we should have, it just adds the tests pertinent for
this patch to avoid regressions and test this specific functionality.
Missing tests should be added in another patch.

Closes-Bug: #1641716
Change-Id: I374a8a187b93da5f946f0243c841ba0b54273401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/397359/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('cinder.volume.driver.BaseVD.failover_host', mock.Mock(side_effect=exception.VolumeDriverException(''))) def test_failover_host_driver_exception(self): svc = utils.create_service( self.context, host=self.host, active_backend_id=None, replication_status=fields.ReplicationStatus.FAILING_OVER) self.manager.failover_host(self.context, mock.sentinel.backend_id) db_svc = objects.Service.get_by_id(self.context, svc.id) self.assertEqual(fields.ReplicationStatus.FAILOVER_ERROR, db_svc.replication_status)

subject: Add more detail to help text for reclaim_instance_interval option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 17:25:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/compute.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/06de08363c82cf02f434f641177548f88c23ea07', 'message': "Add more detail to help text for reclaim_instance_interval option

The reclaim_instance_interval config option is read from both the
API and compute nodes so it's important for people using this option
to understand that they need to set it in both places, because otherwise
you could soft delete an instance from the API but it will not get
reclaimed (hard deleted) unless the compute host it's running on also
has that same configuration set.

This also fixes the point about how to get an instance out of the
soft deleted state before it's reclaimed, which is via the 'restore'
action, not a 'recover' action which doesn't exist in the REST API.

Change-Id: I0aecaea7b76a57ed3b409608800eeaea151451d0
Partial-Bug: #1650328

commit_message:
Add more detail to help text for reclaim_instance_interval option

The reclaim_instance_interval config option is read from both the
API and compute nodes so it's important for people using this option
to understand that they need to set it in both places, because otherwise
you could soft delete an instance from the API but it will not get
reclaimed (hard deleted) unless the compute host it's running on also
has that same configuration set.

This also fixes the point about how to get an instance out of the
soft deleted state before it's reclaimed, which is via the 'restore'
action, not a 'recover' action which doesn't exist in the REST API.

Change-Id: I0aecaea7b76a57ed3b409608800eeaea151451d0
Partial-Bug: #1650328
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/411425/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This option decides whether the server to be deleted will be put intodelete queue by using the restore action. If the deleted server remainsdeleted by a periodic task in the compute service automatically. Note that this option is read from both the API and compute nodes, and must be set globally otherwise servers could be put into a soft deleted state in the API and never actually reclaimed (deleted) on the compute node.
deleted_lines: This option decides whether the server to be deleted will still be indelete queue by using recover action. If the deleted server remainsdeleted by compute service automatically.

Mostly based on this blog:

  http://blog.oddbit.com/2015/06/26/openstack-networking-without-dhcp/

Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/392565/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help="""Path to '/etc/network/interfaces' template. The path to a template file for the '/etc/network/interfaces'-style file, which will be populated by nova and subsequently used by cloudinit. This provides a method to configure network connectivity in environments without a DHCP server. The template will be rendered using Jinja2 template engine, and receive a top-level key called ``interfaces``. This key will contain a list of dictionaries, one for each interface. Refer to the cloudinit documentaion for more information: https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources.html Possible values: * A path to a Jinja2-formatted template for a Debian '/etc/network/interfaces' file. This applies even if using a RHEL-derived guest Related options: * ``flat_inject``: This must be set to ``True`` to ensure nova embeds network configuration information in the metadata provided through the config drive. """),

commit_message:
conf: add warning for vm's max delete attempts

This patch resolves TODO by John Garbutt.
Added warning in compute's code about changing min flag value for
maximum_instance_delete_attempts.
Additionally reformatted help text messages that were still inconsistent.

Change-Id: I74ab7293d967e441ff8fbecab52a8d20a5a687f8
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

commit_message:
Remove all mocks from datagram test

That is because current mock usage which can skip the actual funciton
pass, is too painful. This version avoid all mock.patch and then
refactors the code.

Now, we have abstraction class SBusDatagramTestMixin designed to gather
common setUp and common test suite.

And then, each test class for sort of SBusDatagram child classes is
using the Mixin and defines some more tests for the class specific
assertions.

Note that, this patch also changes SBusExexuteDatagram init args to be
able to take 'command' args in the first place of arguments to be same
as parent SBusDatagram definition. It is to make it transparent for
testing purpose. If any good idea to remove it, always welcome to that.

Change-Id: I69ea2cb4ec7993f68260b99def4e506ae3818fee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/50/411650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Each child Datagram should define what fd types are expected with # list format _required_fd_types = None if type(self) == SBusDatagram: raise NotImplementedError( 'SBusDatagram class should not be initialized as bare') self._check_required_fd_types(fd_types) def _check_required_fd_types(self, given_fd_types): if self._required_fd_types is None: raise NotImplementedError( 'SBusDatagram class should define _required_fd_types') # the first len(self._required_fd_types) types should be fit # to the required list if given_fd_types[:len(self._required_fd_types)] != \ self._required_fd_types: (given_fd_types, self._required_fd_types)) _required_fd_types = [sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_SERVICE_OUT] _required_fd_types = [sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_TASK_ID, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT_METADATA, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_LOGGER] def __init__(self, command, fds, metadata, params=None, task_id=None): # TODO(kota_): the args command is not used in ExecuteDatagram # but it could be worthful to taransparent init # for other datagram classes. extra_fd_types = [ md['storlets']['type'] == sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT for md in metadata[len(self._required_fd_types):]] if not all(extra_fd_types): raise ValueError( 'Extra data should be SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT: %' % metadata) return SBusExecuteDatagram(command, fds, metadata, params, task_id)
deleted_lines: required_fd_types = [] self._check_required_fd_types(fd_types, self.required_fd_types) def _check_required_fd_types(self, given_fd_types, required_fd_types): if given_fd_types != required_fd_types: (given_fd_types, required_fd_types)) self.required_fd_types = [sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_SERVICE_OUT] def __init__(self, fds, metadata, params=None, task_id=None): self.required_fd_types = [sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_TASK_ID, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT_METADATA, sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_LOGGER] extra_input_num = len(metadata) - len(self.required_fd_types) if extra_input_num > 0: self.required_fd_types.extend([sbus_fd.SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT] * extra_input_num) return SBusExecuteDatagram(fds, metadata, params, task_id)

Support update consistencygroups quota

This patch add a parameter "consistencygroups" for quota-class-update
command.
The quota-update command alreasy has this parameter.

commit_message:
Raise FirewallRuleInvalidAction when action value is not string

This patch fix the internal server error, when create/update
firewall rules action with integer value. Add the check to
verify the input is unicode.

Closes-Bug: #1649833
Change-Id: Ia8e3eb46a756fbcf4198c17fbffcd7526baafb5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/61/410661/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif not isinstance(value, six.text_type): raise FirewallRuleInvalidAction( action=value, values=fw_valid_action_values )

commit_message:
Add reference for zaqar-cli

This patch introduce the zaqar cli usage with openstack cli.

Change-Id: I5c5aee3c36e15127d535f7a48122de34615979e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/88/409588/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. ## WARNING ##################################### .. This file is tool-generated. Do not edit manually. .. ################################################## ================================================================== A multi-tenant cloud messaging service (zaqar) command-line client ================================================================== The zaqar client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the a multi-tenant cloud messaging and notification service API. It was implemented as an plugin for OpenStack CLI, so it could be called with OpenStack CLI. This chapter documents :command:`openstack queue` version ``1.0.0``. For help on a specific :command:`openstack queue` command, enter: .. code-block:: console $ openstack queue COMMAND -h/--help .. _openstack_queue_command_usage: openstack queue usage ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ There are 7 zaqar subcommands in OpenStack CLI. .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue --help Command "queue" matches: queue create queue delete queue get metadata queue list queue set metadata queue signed url queue stats openstack queue create ---------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue create [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] <queue_name> Create a queue. **Positional arguments:** ``<queue_name>`` Name of the queue. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit. openstack queue delete ---------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue delete [-h] <queue_name> Delete a queue. **Positional arguments:** ``<queue_name>`` Name of the queue. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit. openstack queue get metadata ---------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue get metadata [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] <queue_name> Get queue metadata. **Positional arguments:** ``<queue_name>`` Name of the queue. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit. openstack queue list -------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue list [-h] [-f {csv,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--marker <queue_id>] [--limit <limit>] List available queues. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit. ``--marker <queue_id>`` Queue's paging marker. ``--limit <limit>`` Page size limit. openstack queue set metadata ---------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue set metadata [-h] <queue_name> <queue_metadata> Set queue metadata. **Positional arguments:** ``<queue_name>`` Name of the queue. ``<queue_metadata>`` Queue metadata. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit. openstack queue signed url -------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue signed url [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [--paths <paths>] [--ttl-seconds <ttl_seconds>] [--methods <methods>] <queue_name> Create a queue. **Positional arguments:** ``<queue_name>`` Name of the queue. ``<queue_metadata>`` Queue metadata. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit. ``--paths <paths>`` Allowed paths in a comma-separated list. Options: messages, subscriptions, claims. ``--ttl-seconds <ttl_seconds>`` Length of time (in seconds) until the signature expires. ``--methods <methods>`` HTTP methods to allow as a comma-separated list. Options: GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, POST, PUT, DELETE. openstack queue stats --------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack queue stats [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] <queue_name> Get queue stats. **Positional arguments:** ``<queue_name>`` Name of the queue. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit.

Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

The correct order expected by testtools is assertEqual(expected, observed).

commit_message:
Add experimental windmill job to buildimages

As we move forward with using lxc for testing, we'll need to start
building images. Add an experimental job to do this.

Once working, we'll be moving this to a periodic job.

Change-Id: Idb42c1f8e1af23315015343908c999c979cf3312
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix exit for statement when optional equals true

If optional equals true, the logic should be that exit current item
cycle and go into next item cycle, so should modify return to continue

Change-Id: Ia83c7f5bd0cca214ed9a631166fccf80b1b4ae79
Closes-Bug: #1649778

commit_message:
Move enable_sig and release to ceph::params

This patch moves these parameters to ceph::params. This will allow
the code to make better decisions in future patches.

Change-Id: I26beaea4c1e036b7a8cbb9935a9b3206c8008b2c
(cherry picked from commit df1e04c81c39f33452aaa77063544c4cddb227be)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/54/410454/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*enable_sig*] Whether or not enable SIG repository. # CentOS SIG repository contains Ceph packages built by CentOS community. # https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/Storage/ # Optional. Defaults to False # # [*release*] The name of the Ceph release to install # Optional. Default to 'hammer'. # $exec_timeout = 600, $packages = 'ceph', # just provide the minimum per default $enable_sig = false, $release = 'hammer',
deleted_lines: $exec_timeout = 600, $packages = 'ceph', # just provide the minimum per default

commit_message:
Handle NotImplementedError for image cache cloning

The base driver throws NotImplementedError, so if a driver does
not override create_cloned_volume the image caching needs to handle
this and treat it like a general cloning failure to failback to
the default handling.

Change-Id: I06ad0e71e6c502945975629141ec573110482954
Closes-bug: #1642394
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/81/398581/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except NotImplementedError as e: LOG.warning(_LW('Backend does not support creating image-volume ' 'clone. Will fail back to default behavior.'))

commit_message:
Put in magnumclient service_type workaround

Older versions of os-client-config only have an api version for
'container'. It's pretty easy to put in a workaround for that.

Change-Id: I1edaa7ee416e4cc85bffb999a0e66b9494dabc37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/80/412080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Workaround for os-client-config <=1.24.0 which thought of # this as container rather than container-infra (so did we all) service_key = 'container-infra' if not self.cloud_config.get_api_version('container-infra'): service_key = 'container' service_key, magnumclient.client.Client)

commit_message:
Rename to EMCVNXDriver

From Newton release, EMC VNX backends have been upgraded to use
cinder.volume.drivers.emc.vnx.driver.EMCVNXDriver for both FC and
ISCSI storage protocols.
But volume stats are still pointing to VNXFCDriver and
VNXISCSIDriver. This patch has changed it to unified name EMCVNXDriver

Change-Id: I2eeb02544e388ba976373710b9d42aacc1453969
Closes-Bug: #1649952
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/57/410857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stats['volume_backend_name'] = backend_name or 'EMCVNXDriver' stats['volume_backend_name'] = backend_name or 'EMCVNXDriver'
deleted_lines: stats['volume_backend_name'] = backend_name or 'VNXISCSIDriver' stats['volume_backend_name'] = backend_name or 'VNXFCDriver'

commit_message:
Helm charts for cinder keystone v1 endpoints

Helm charts for creation of the cinder keystone v1
endpoints. These include internal, public, and admin
endpoints

Change-Id: I7131e66d7c507d51023c7e323d0ca8b54fd7585f
Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-microservices

commit_message:
Improve help message for scheduler_available_filters

Config option scheduler_available_filters default value
'all' is not much clear as it doesn't mean that all the
existing filters are enabled. It is just the indication
of the case when all of the available filters
(from DEFAULT.scheduler_available_filters in nova.conf)
are enabled.

Also add clear doc string for is_scheduler_filter_enabled
function which is used to evaluate this option value.

Change-Id: If9a52003309686cc257e62737e52c2cc52ddc659
Closes-Bug: #1628443
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/405064/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Check the list of enabled compute scheduler filters from config. This function will check if requested compute scheduler filter is available and configured in config file. If scheduler_available_filters in config is set to 'all'(default value) then, this function will return True always with assumption that requested filter is one of available filter in nova ("nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters"). """
deleted_lines: """Check the list of enabled compute scheduler filters from config. """

commit_message:
Fix nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts RequestContext

In the nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts command, the nova.context
module is erroneously being passed to a database API function instead
of a RequestContext object, causing the error on the command line:

  error: 'module' object has no attribute 'session'

This corrects the argument and adds a test assertion for the
RequestContext.

Closes-Bug: #1650694

Change-Id: I7b5468218e79ffc77adf15d2f00c063095d62af3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/412035/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
nova-manage: squash oslo_policy debug logging

I don't know when it started but you can see from a modern
usage of nova-manage that oslo_policy debug logging is being
emitted. We don't need that debug information in the console
for nova-manage, so this patch hides it just like we do for
oslo_db.

Change-Id: If1a8e8d473846f2626f5e01210f00ad06916a383
Related-Bug: #1650694

commit_message:
Helm entrypoint hooks

This PS adds helm entrypoint support into the common code, enabling
microservices that depend on them to gain helm entrypoint support.

commit_message:
Fix bashate errors and warnings (lint)

Fix 1 warning and 1 error in bash syntax:

1) E043: Arithmetic compound has inconsistent return semantics.
   Fix the bash syntax to be compliant.

2) ERROR: Split export and assignments in 2 files. Ignore the files.
   Fix the bash syntax to be compliant.
   Note: this test has been introducted by
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/400542/

Change-Id: I3c1134336033a8b5f2d56cd87fa190d9a354ecc0

commit_message:
[LVM,Generic drivers] Fix relationships between parent and child shares

Reportedly [1], the kernel-nfs-server has a bug where we have overlap of
filesystem identifiers using LVM volumes and their snapshots.

We face this bug in manila LVM driver and Generic driver when we use
cinder LVM driver. So, fix it generating unique UUID for all
snapshots (only for LVM, because we cannot do it in Generic driver
while we do not have "mount-snapshot" feature support there) and
child volumes that will be exported as child shares.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1071733

Change-Id: Ib93bfb0d4184da1e70ecece6fde6931e44d05a30
Closes-Bug: #1645751

commit_message:
Modify Vagrant box to bento/ubuntu-16.04

Modify Vagrant box from ubuntu/xenial64 to bento/ubuntu-16.04.
This resolves the issue with the read only file system due to
the scsi driver issue in the ubuntu/xenial64 Vagrant box. See
the review at, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366024, for
more details and discussion.

bento/ubuntu-16.04 uses the SATA driver and the prior issues
that we had run into with the bento box not working either
have been resolved. Note, we had tested bento/ubuntu-16.04
earlier and it did not work, but whatever issue that we had
been running into has now been resolved.

Change-Id: Ia754dc83fe65f391bee1e5e51851334a856309e8

commit_message:
Minor changes in the document

Small changes to document to comply with the openstack document
style and a minor gramatical correction.

Change-Id: Icf1412b5957e00347e13aed9b9685d42539de30f
Partial-Implements: blueprint mistral-doc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/39/409639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Mistral is capable of executing workflows on external OpenStack clouds, different from the one defined in the `mistral.conf` file in the `keystone_authtoken` section. (More detail in the :doc:`configuration_guide`). For example, if the mistral server is configured to authenticate with the `http://keystone1.example.com` cloud and the user wants to execute the workflow on the `http://keystone2.example.com` cloud. $ export OS_AUTH_URL=http://keystone1.example.com:5000/v3 $ export OS_USERNAME=mistral_user $ export OS_TARGET_AUTH_URL=http://keystone2.example.com:5000/v3 $ export OS_TARGET_USERNAME=cloud_user.. note:: Every `OS_*` parameter has an `OS_TARGET_*` correspondent. For more detail, check out `mistral --help` The `OS_*` parameters are used to authenticate and authorize the user with Mistral, that is, to check if the user is allowed to utilize the Mistral service. Whereas the `OS_TARGET_*` parameters are used to define the user that executes the workflow on the external cloud, keystone2.example.com/.As a user of Mistral, I want to execute a workflow with a different user on the cloud.With the targeting feature, it is possible to execute a workflow on any arbitrary cloud without additional configuration on the Mistral server side. If authentication is turned off in the Mistral server (Pecan's `auth_enable = False` option in `mistral.conf`), there is no need to set the `keystone_authtoken` section. It is possible to have Mistral use an external OpenStack cloud even when it isn't deployed in an OpenStack environment (i.e. no Keystone integration). $ mistral \ --os-target-auth-url=http://keystone2.example.com:5000/v3 \ --os-target-username=testuser \ --os-target-tenant=testtenant \ --os-target-password="MistralRuleZ" \ run-action heat.stacks_list This setup is particularly useful when Mistral is used in standalone mode, when the Mistral service is not part of the OpenStack cloud and runs separately.
deleted_lines: Mistral is capable of executing workflows on external OpenStack clouds, different from the one defined in the `mistral.conf` file in the `keystone_authtoken` section. (More detail in the :doc:`configuration_guide`). For example, if the mistral server is configured to authenticate with the `http://keystone1.example.com` cloud and the user wants to execute the workflow on the `http://keystone2.example.com` cloud. export OS_AUTH_URL=http://keystone1.example.com:5000/v3 export OS_USERNAME=mistral_user export OS_TARGET_AUTH_URL=http://keystone2.example.com:5000/v3 export OS_TARGET_USERNAME=cloud_user.. note:: Every `OS_*` parameter has an `OS_TARGET_*` correspondent. For more detail, check out `mistral --help` The `OS_*` parameters are used to authenticate and authorize the user with Mistral, that is, to check if the user is allowed to utilize the Mistral service. Whereas the `OS_TARGET_*` parameters are used to define the user that executes the workflow on the external cloud, keystone2.example.com/.As a user of Mistral, I want to execute a workflow with a different user on the cloud.With the targeting feature, it is possible to execute a workflow on any arbitrary cloud without additional configuration on the Mistral server side. If authentication is turned off in the Mistral server (Pecan's `auth_enable = False` option in `mistral.conf`), there is no need to set the `keystone_authtoken` section. It is possible to have Mistral use an external OpenStack cloud even when it isn't deploy in an OpenStack environment (i.e. no Keystone integration). mistral \ --os-target-auth-url=http://keystone2.example.com:5000/v3 \ --os-target-username=testuser \ --os-target-tenant=testtenant \ --os-target-password="MistralRuleZ" \ run-action heat.stacks_list This setup is particularly useful when Mistral is used in standalone mode, when the Mistral service is not part of the OpenStack cloud and runs separately.

commit_message:
Fix rolling upgrades

A previous commit defaulted it off and incorrectly always tagged the
pod as safe for rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: I8473b991bf18956b72193dce143ca73a18334128

commit_message:
H803 hacking have been deprecated

H803 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements.txt require hacking hacking<0.12,>=0.11.0.
So remove H803 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1650847

Change-Id: I115c8d3236e857a6b5b54508d1b10cd93d6ee3b6

commit_message:
Add filtering options to the address scope list command

Add --name, --ip-version, --project, --project-domain,
--share, --no-share options to the address scope list command.

Change-Id: I8ece8da473d07dfc21dfb5b17de47624241f0142
Closes-Bug: #1636046
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-commands-options

added_lines: --- features: - | Add ``--name``, ``--ip-version``, ``--project``, ``project-domain``, ``--share``, ``--no-share`` options to the ``address scope list`` command. [Bug `1636046 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1636046>`_]

commit_message:
cors: update default configuration

Set_defaults has been added into oslo_middleware. So we use it to
override the configuration defaults.

Change-Id: Iae4ba9dd7c6cd46ae182b0cdc2ea7654c98e71d7
Closes-Bug: #1641496
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/58/394058/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[WIP]refactor db store

remove specific resource get/set/delete/... methods in
db_store, instead we use the exist keys/values/get/...
methods in db_store which make the code more clean

(currently process util fip)

Change-Id: Icde89fa207ed919c515e4cb32ef8c8f83711d862

commit_message:
uniform the method name for resource operations(qos)

all the methods look like this:

action + "_" + resource(single object)

action + "_all_" + resources(multi objects)

action:create/update/delete/get

resource:
lswitch/lport/lrouter/secgroup/floatingip...

Change-Id: Ie8b997ed960fb5ab47ce3b05eb502c6e25ff3105
Partial-bug: #1636888

commit_message:
uniform resource method name in df_local_controller

Uniform resource method name in df_local_controller which
is good for further code clean and optimization.
All the methods look like this:

action + "_" + resource

action:update/delete

resource:
lswitch/lport/lrouter/secgroup/floatingip/qospolicy...

Change-Id: I57b9129ae7190f498b55107ea061cda0a9a3d8df

commit_message:
Add --default option to "volume type list"

Add "--default" option to volume v2's "type list"
command, it will show which volume type the volume
service has set as default.

Implements: bp cinder-command-support
Change-Id: Iae7ebc633ebe5554cc88390a84361887ec211fb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/23/398123/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help=_('List additional fields in output') ) "--default", action='store_true', default=False, help=_('List the default volume type') ) public_group.add_argument( volume_client = self.app.client_manager.volume if parsed_args.default: data = [volume_client.volume_types.default()] else: is_public = None if parsed_args.public: is_public = True if parsed_args.private: is_public = False data = volume_client.volume_types.list( is_public=is_public)
deleted_lines: help=_('List additional fields in output')) is_public = None if parsed_args.public: is_public = True if parsed_args.private: is_public = False data = self.app.client_manager.volume.volume_types.list( is_public=is_public)

commit_message:
Update localrc to reflect correct values

- Making ubuntu16.04 as the default in the comments.
- Removing older comments which are either obsolete or using a different
  format.

Change-Id: I9940406e7d16abda9969b7f91049f01baa669370

commit_message:
Python port of osbash

This is a pretty direct port of osbash to Python.

The entry point is st.py; use ./st.py --help for help.

osbash.sh should work as before.

Implements: blueprint labs-python-port
Change-Id: Ifcccc420d58cbe907ce29542e4200803fa39e134
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/55/396955/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: REM Elevate credentials, code courtesy of Matthew Newton REM http://blog.mnewton.com/articles/Windows-Installer-Batch-Script-Revisited.html REM Check for permissions >nul 2>&1 "%SYSTEMROOT%\system32\cacls.exe" "%SYSTEMROOT%\system32\config\system" REM If error flag set, we do not have admin. if '%errorlevel%' NEQ '0' ( echo Requesting administrative privileges... goto UACPrompt ) else ( goto gotAdmin ) :UACPrompt echo Set UAC = CreateObject^("Shell.Application"^) > "%temp%\getadmin.vbs" echo UAC.ShellExecute "%~s0", "", "", "runas", 1 >> "%temp%\getadmin.vbs" "%temp%\getadmin.vbs" REM we are done, exiting recursive call exit /B :gotAdmin if exist "%temp%\getadmin.vbs" ( del "%temp%\getadmin.vbs" ) echo We have admin privileges, proceeding... REM vim: set ai ts=4 sw=4 et ft=dosbatch:

commit_message:
Update sphinx documentation to fix CI issues

- Removing README.rst being included in the generated docs.
- Project documentation from now on will not rely on README.rst.
- Updated test-requiements bumping version numbers for sphinx,
  oslosphinx and related dependencies.

Change-Id: Ic6c2b03b84c16cdb054e915b673d7e2f2adf7d56

deleted_lines: commands = rm -rf doc/build python setup.py build_sphinx

use util method to parse request obj

this patch revises the webhook api to use util method
to parse request object.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/69/412169/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: body = obj_base.SenlinObject.normalize_req( 'WebhookTriggerRequestBody', body) obj = util.parse_request( 'WebhookTriggerRequest', req, {'identity': webhook_id, 'body': body})
deleted_lines: import jsonschema import six from webob import exc from senlin.objects.requests import webhooks as vorw try: body = obj_base.SenlinObject.normalize_req( 'WebhookTriggerRequestBody', body) norm_req = obj_base.SenlinObject.normalize_req( 'WebhookTriggerRequest', {'identity': webhook_id, 'body': body}) obj = vorw.WebhookTriggerRequest.obj_from_primitive(norm_req) jsonschema.validate(norm_req, obj.to_json_schema()) except ValueError as ex: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(six.text_type(ex)) except jsonschema.exceptions.ValidationError as ex: raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(six.text_type(ex.message))

commit_message:
[Tempest] Fix concurrency issue in scenario test

One our scenario tempest test [1] started failing randomly.
It was failing on resources removal. So, start deleting resources
in proper order.

[1] manila_tempest_tests.tests.scenario.test_share_basic_ops.\
        TestShareBasicOpsNFS.test_mount_share_one_vm

Change-Id: Ib1eba66e4d27552cf8e78b302a9f03ac84d978ba
Closes-Bug: #1647350

subject: Support A/A in delete actions and get_capabilities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:08:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7ef08537246831681f0b469f3d590e10b518702a', 'message': '[WIP] Suport A/A in delete operations and get_capabilities

This patch allows deleting operations and getting capabilities in HA
Active-Active configurations.

To allow this we have to use the cluster topic queue in the Message
Broker, so following RPC methods in cinder/volume/rpcapi have been
changed:

- delete_volume
- delete_snapshot
- delete_consistencygroup
- delete_cgsnapshot

When the cluster field is not set all RPC calls will behave as before,
sending it to the host topic queue.

Change-Id: I8bcf26afec7f2c54f281dc1ac771825b1c1625ad
Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support

commit_message:
Support A/A in delete actions and get_capabilities

This patch allows deleting operations and getting capabilities in HA
Active-Active configurations.

To allow this we have to use the cluster topic queue in the Message
Broker, so following RPC methods in cinder/volume/rpcapi have been
changed:

- delete_volume
- delete_snapshot
- delete_consistencygroup
- delete_cgsnapshot
- delete_group
- delete_group_snapshot

When the cluster field is not set all RPC calls will behave as before,
sending it to the host topic queue.

Change-Id: I8bcf26afec7f2c54f281dc1ac771825b1c1625ad
Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support

added_lines: self.volume_rpcapi.delete_snapshot(context, volume, snapshot,

commit_message:
libvirt: Detach volumes from a domain before detaching any encryptors

I983f80822a5 introduced retry logic around the detaching of volumes from
a libvirt domain. However it also reordered the surrounding code so that
we attempt to detach any encryptors from a volume first while the volume
is still attached to the domain. This can lead to `Device or resource
busy` errors if the volume is still being used by the instance when we
attempt to detach the encryptors.

Closes-bug: #1642628
Change-Id: Ia0f8e725ec8a0fbc44bd4592b021dea978cf4e4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/398479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The volume must be detached from the VM before disconnecting it # from its encryptor. Otherwise, the encryptor may report that the # volume is still in use. wait_for_detach()
deleted_lines: # The volume must be detached from the VM before # disconnecting it from its encryptor. Otherwise, the # encryptor may report that the volume is still in use. wait_for_detach()

This patch adds checking exception for cluster.find in action_create2,
also adds related unit test.

Change-Id: Id908e81b0e327d98cbbc0067e3cf1bb5a2a383eb
'}]
commit_message:
Add checking exception in action_create2

This patch adds checking exception for cluster.find in action_create2,
also adds related unit test.

Change-Id: Id908e81b0e327d98cbbc0067e3cf1bb5a2a383eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/55/412055/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: target = co.Cluster.find(ctx, req.cluster_id) except exception.ResourceNotFound: msg = _("Cannot find the given cluster: %s") % req.cluster_id raise exception.BadRequest(msg=msg)
deleted_lines: # TODO(Anyone): check exception and return BadRequest target = co.Cluster.find(ctx, req.cluster_id)

Add checking exception in node-list2

This patch adds checking exception for cluster.find in node_list2,
also adds related unit test.

commit_message:
move l2-multicast case to ml2_l2 case

There are duplicate methods in test_l2_multicast.py and
test_ml2_l2_flows.py, and it's reasonable to put the
l2_multicast_flow check into test_ml2_l2_flows.py

Change-Id: I7e03ba41a5453936f2cfe4d88b8e12dbcd1b2449
